Luisa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre  para tener un lugar digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Luisa, 54, is married and has two children, ages 22 and 23.  She's a native of the department of Chinandega, in the western part of the country.  Chinandega is known for being a very productive commercial region.

Luisa works as a teacher in one of the schools in town.  The loan she's requesting is to make improvements on her home: to install ceramic tiles so the furniture doesn't deteriorate.  She has been doing the improvements little by little because with the previous loans she managed to buy the land.  She has been building the house for herself and her family.  It has been a great achievement and benefit to have a decent place to live.

With the loan she's going to buy construction material such as ceramic tiles, cement, and glue.

Luisa's grateful for the help the Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries so they have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, cement, and glue

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of four children ages 15, 14, 11 and 9. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She has been operating a fishing pond venture (fish farming) for more than six years now. She is also engaged in growing vegetables and bananas.

Marites wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy fingerlings for her fish pond.

In the future, Marites hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings for her fish pond.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 52 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children between 10 and 20 years old, all of whom are enrolled in school. He has spent 24 years in farming. He would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Milvia

texts.es:
Milvia, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Wilson quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 03 hijos. Juntos habitan una  casa alquilada en compañía de sus hijos a quienes quieren mucho. La actividad que realiza Milvia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas para eso tiene en su casa una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos  a temperatura helada al gusto de sus clientes por lo caluroso de la zona, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. De las ganancias que acumula, las deriva para acondicionar una pequeña tienda en su casa, ahí podrá vender golosinas. 
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable, eso lo ayuda a tener ingresos y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, considerando que así lograrán progresar más rápidamente.
Por tanto,desea continuar y aumentar el stock de sus productos para ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida y contenta al saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de sus mercaderías en mayor volumen como bebidas gasificadas y golosinas, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen, así obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
At 30 years old, Milvia is a very hard working woman, dedicated and with a desire to come out ahead.  She lives with Wilson who works in construction and is father of her three children.  Together, they live with their children whom they love very much.  Milvia makes a living selling carbonated beverages of various flavors and brands.  This is why she has a refrigerator in her home that keeps her products at a cool temperature, much to her customers' satisfaction.  The city where she works is hot so she treats her customers in a very friendly manner.  

She uses her revenues to air condition the small store in her home so she can sell candy.  She considers her business to be very valuable as it gives her income to help her husband with the home expenses.  She thinks this will help them progress soon.  She wishes to continue her business and to increase her stock so that her business grows.  

This will be her third loan with MFP institution.  She is very grateful and happy knowing that she can count on this type of support for her business.  She is also very happy with her communal bank and its members as they are very responsible.  

With the 1500 PEN, she will purchase her merchandise, like carbonated beverages and candy, in greater volume.  She will seek good prices and thus make stronger revenues.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated beverages and candy.

loans.name: Edita Del Socorro

texts.es: Edita, originaria de Granada, de oficio costurera. Dice que el financiamiento obtenido le ha abierto, muchas puertas, ha comprado materia prima para trabajar como telas, hilos, zippers, encajes y accesorios para la costura pues tenía pedidos que cumplir y gracias al a ayuda logro terminarlos en tiempo y forma. Durante la época navideña tiene muchas encargos de togas, vestidos para graduaciones, trajes para bautizos y es cuando más materia prima requiere es por ello que requiere utilizar este crédito para comprar telas, encajes, lentejuelas, cintas etc. Siempre sigue con sus planes de expandirse y dar a conocer sus productos en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
Edita is a native of Granada and a seamstress.  She says the loan she got has opened a lot of doors for her.  She has bought raw materials for work, such as fabric, thread, zippers, lace, and sewing accessories.  She had orders to finish and thanks to the help she managed to finish them in a timely and appropriate manner.

During the Christmas season she has a lot of orders for gowns, graduation outfits, and baptism suits.  This is when she most needs supplies.  This is why she needs this loan to buy fabric, lace, sequins, ribbons, etc.

She's still continuing with her plans to expand and to make her work known in the city of Masaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, sequins, ribbon, etc.

loans.name: Denys

texts.en:
Denys, 44 years old and married to a farmer, has spent 26 years in farming. He is requesting this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and pay for labor during maize production.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 37 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Es madre de 03 hijos, de los cuales el mayor vive a lado de su padre, mientras que los 02 menores viven con ella ya que son hijos de su conviviente actual.  Vive en casa de su madre junto a sus 02 hijos, su madre y sus hermanos, se esfuerza mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños. El trabajo de Ana, consiste en la venta juguetes, collares, aretes, pulseras y otras cosas mas que usan como accesorios sobre todo para las niñas. Sale a diario en busca de sus clientes para ofrecer sus buenos y novedosos productos.  Lleva trabajando con ésta actividad por más de 03 años, lo hace sola y aunque ahora está muy bien preparada para hacer su trabajo, comenta que cuando empezó tuvo muchas dificultades como el no saber que estrategia usar para llegar al cliente, ahora es muy buena en lo que hace y día a día se supera mas y mas.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le agrada su trabajo porque le deja un tiempo libre y lo usa como ella desea, además que tiene muy buena ganancias ya que gana un promedio del 50% de su inversión, espera mas adelante poner una tienda, pero por ahora lo que más desea es aumentar su capital aumentando la inversión con su negocio. Este será el  préstamo número 04 con MFP, está muy emocionada al saber que tendrá un respaldo económico para poder seguir con su inversión. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprar mercadería, como juguetes, collares, pulseras y otros accesorios para su venta. Además de buscar precios bajos por sus compras en volumen para obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is a good and pleasant woman.  She's the mother of three children.  The oldest lives with his father, while the two younger ones live with her because they're the children of her current partner.  She lives in her mother's house with her two children, her mother, and her siblings.  She works very hard to be able to give her children a better quality of life.

Ana's job is selling toys, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and other accessories, especially for girls.  She goes out every day in search of customers to offer her good and new products.  She has been doing this work for more than three years.  She does it alone and, although now she's very well prepared to do her job, she says that when she began she had a lot of problems, such as not having a strategy for finding customers.  Now she's very good at what she does and she improves more and more every day.  She considers her business very profitable because it gives her good earnings.

She likes her job because it gives her free time to use as she likes.  Also, she has very good earnings, an average of 50% of her investment.  She hopes to set up a store in the future, but for now what she most wants is to increase her capital and her investment in her business.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She's very excited to know that she'll have financial support to be able to continue with her investment.  With the requested amount of 1500 soles [PEN] she'll buy merchandise such as toys, necklaces, bracelets, and other accessories to sell.  She'll also look for low prices for her wholesale purchases to get a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to buy toys, necklaces, and bracelets

loans.name: Lucy Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucy del Carmen de 35 anos de edad, de la localidad de Chichigalpa, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Madre soltera con tres hijos de 9, 8,4 anos de edad, todos están estudiando. Lucy tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general  y granos básicos dese hace 15 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Lucy se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos como madera soltera luchando día día para el sustento el sustento de su familia. La rutina de trabajo de esta de Lucy es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias por la mañana vender granos básico como :arroz, frijoles, azucar, jabon, detergente, cereales  en el mercado de la localidad, y por la tarde vender de forma ambulante su mercadería en general a clientes fijos y eventuales como : pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, pijama, ropa de niño y cosméticos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio aprovechado que viene la temporada navideña y las ventas se incrementan. Lucy del Carmen agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre económicamente para t ener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Lucy del Carmen is 35 years old and from the town of Chichigalpa, located in the west of the country. She is a single mother and has three children, aged 9, 8, and 4, all of whom go to school. Lucy has worked selling general merchandise and basic supplies for the last 15 years. Lucy is a hard-working, respectable woman, who has raised her children as a single mother, struggling day after day to provide for her family. Lucy’s daily routine involves working 10 hours a day. In the mornings she sells staple goods such as rice, beans, detergent, and cereal in the local market, and in the afternoons, she works as a street vendor selling pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, children’s clothes, and cosmetics to both regular and occasional customers. She needs this loan to invest in stock for her business in order to take advantage of the Christmas period when sales rise. Lucy del Carmen is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with low incomes in poor countries allowing people like her to obtain decent work.

loans.use: to invest in stock for her business selling staple goods such as rice, beans, oil, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi, de 36 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy emprendedora. Es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene 04 hijos, ellos estudian y ayudan en las labores del hogar. Tiene una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su conviviente y sus  hijos quienes son el motivo de esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que ella trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Noemi consiste en la venta de abarrotes y otros productos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa, atiende desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus clientes quienes van muy seguido pues tienen la seguridad que siempre encontraran lo que buscan. Considera rentable su negocio además que le deja tiempo libre para poder realizar otras actividades, como preparar sus refrescos para venderlos, helados y todo tipo de negocio que ella cree que le pueda dejar alguna ganancia.  Por tanto espera agrandar su negocio, pues ella sabe muy bien que mientras más grande sea, mayores ganancias tendrá. Este será el préstamo número 7 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. De igual manera de los préstamos recibidos anteriormente se compromete a ser un cliente puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2,000 mil soles, comprará más mercadería para vender en su tienda, entre ellos, productos como bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y sabores, conservas, lácteos, bebidas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Noemí, 36, is a good, kind, very enterprising woman.  She lives with her partner with whom she has four children attending school and who help with housework.  She owns a house where she shares her days with her spouse and children who are the reason for all her hard work and sacrifice; she works hard to be able to provide them with a better quality of life.

Noemí’s work consists in selling groceries and other products.  She has a small store located at home that she tends to starting very early in the morning.  She opens her store’s doors to await her customers who come by often because they are sure to find what they are looking for.  She considers her business to be profitable and it also leaves her with free time to do other things like make refreshments and frozen treats to sell as well as any other business she feels might produce profits.  She hopes to enlarge her business because she knows that the larger it is the greater profits she’ll earn.  

This will be MFP loan #7 and she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue towards her goals.  Like with her previous loans, she commits to being a punctual client.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more merchandise to sell in her store, among them such things as carbonated soft-drinks of various brands and flavors, canned gods, dairy products and beverages, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 40 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have four children, aged between seven months and nine years old; only two of them attend schools. 

He has spent 23 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizer and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia tiene 36 años de edad, tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 5 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su librería en la localidad de Quebrada Seca, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que esta es la única actividad con la que saca adelante a su hijo, su deseo es el de ver a su hijo profesional y que pueda ejercer su profesión y ser una persona de bien.
texts.en: Sonia, 36, has a five-year-old son.  She sells stationery supplies, office supplies, books, etc.  She sells a variety of goods according to the season.  Her bookstore is located in Quebrada Seca and she lives in the family home.  The loan she’s requesting is to stock up on school supplies for her bookstore because she does very well thanks to the good location of her store; her sales are good and she’s a responsible, hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided since this is the only activity she has to support her son with.  Her wish is to see him become a professional who can practice his profession and be an upstanding citizen.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Lizette Veronica

texts.es: Lizette Verónica de 44 anos de edad, madres soltera con tres hijos, de los cuales uno esta bajo su responsabilidad el pequeño  esta estudiando. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lizette tiene por actividad económica la venta una pulpería  ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 13 anos que se dedica  a dicha actividad. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se vende productos de consumo diario para el hogar y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobrecitos de café, sobrecitos de shampo, sobrecitos de cubos magi, sobrecitos de salsa, jugos, gaseosas, cigarros menudeados, aceite, arroz, frijoles. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelantes  a sus hijas como madre soltera. Con el financiamiento invertirá en capital de trabajo para poder surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diaria y de dicha forma mejorar la atención al cliente y sus ingresos. Lizette sus sueños es poder mantener los estudios de sus hijo hasta que llegue a ser un profesional. Lizette agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lizette Verónica, 44, is a single mother of three children the youngest of whom is still dependent on her and attending school.  She’s from Chinandega Department, a place located in the west of the country.  

Lizette’s activity is a 'pulpería' store located at home.  She’s been in business for 13 years.  A ‘pulpería’ is a small store that sells basic staples that are consumed daily in homes in small quantities like small envelopes of coffee, small envelopes of shampoo, small envelopes of Maggi bouillon cubes, small envelopes of sauce, juices, soft-drinks, individual cigarettes, oil, rice, beans.  

The business arose from the need of having a source of income to support her children as a single mother.  With the financing, she’ll invest in working capital to stock her grocery store with daily use items thus improving customer service and her income.  

Lizette dreams with being able to keep her son in school until he becomes a professional.  Lizette is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide for people of scarce resources from poor countries so they can have dignified ways of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alia Saturnina

texts.es: Alias Saturnino de 45 anos de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos de 20, 21,11 anos de edad. De los cuales los dos menores están estudiando, el mayor ya se graduó. Alias tiene por actividad económica la elaboración de tortillas y venta de ropa nueva desde hace  8 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad.  El negocio de las tortillas la vende por la mañana  en su domicilio y venta de ropa de forma ambulante por la tarde  a sus clientes fijos y eventuales.  El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para darle el sustento a sus hijos y pode sacarle adelante, Alias es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable buena  paga lo cual ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores. EL financiamiento lo necesita  para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar matera prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como maíz, leña, cal, comal, bolsas plásticas. Alias Saturnina agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Alia Saturnino, 45, is a single mother with 3 children aged 20, 21 and 11.  The two youngest are in school, and the oldest has already graduated.  Alia has had a business making tortillas and selling new clothing for 8 years.    She sells tortillas from her house in the morning, and in the afternoons she goes out to sell clothing from place to place to her regular and occasional customers.  She started in business because she needed to have a source of income to support her children and get ahead with them.  Alia is a very hardworking woman, who has demonstrated responsibility with her payments in previous loans.  She needs a loan to invest in working capital and to buy raw materials and supplies to make tortillas, such as: corn, firewood, lime, a tortilla griddle, and plastic bags. Alia Saturnina is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a means to a decent life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to make tortillas, such as: corn, firewood, lime, a griddle and plastic bags

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
Marnie is a 21-year-old married woman and mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for several years now. This is the source of their daily income.

Marnie is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat. Through this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Marnie dreams of making their business a success and saving money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Didace

texts.en:
Didace is 28 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have three children, all very young. 

He has spent 16 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizer and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 47 years old. He is married to a farmer. 

He has spent 27 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizer and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerado vive en Puntarenas. Es una persona con experiencia en la agricultura y ama lo que hace. El tiene su propia finca, y desea empezar a sembrar frijoles y maíz para la venta, aprovechando el clima y la demanda propia de época. Para eso el desea un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de abonos y Insecticidas, necesarios para la producción de estos granos. El desea aumentar su producción y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Gerardo lives in Puntarenas.  He has experience with farming and loves what he does.  He has his own farm and wants to start planting beans and corn to sell in order to take advantage of the climate and demand at this time. To do this, he is requesting a loan of ₡500,000 to purchase fertilizer and insecticide, which are necessary for the production of these grains.  He wants to increase his production so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide, which are necessary for the production of his grains

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista vive en Puntarenas. Es una persona con experiencia en la agricultura y ama lo que hace. El tiene su propia finca, y desea empezar a sembrar frijoles y maíz para la venta, aprovechando el clima y la demanda propia de época. Para eso el desea un préstamo de ₡750 000 (setecientos cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de abonos y Insecticidas, necesarios para la producción de estos granos. El desea aumentar su producción y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juan Bautista lives in Puntarenas.  He is very experienced in agriculture and he loves what he does.  He has his own farm and wants to begin planting beans and corn, taking advantage of the climate and the demand during the season.  In order to do this, he needs a loan of 750,000 colones for the purchase of the necessary fertilizers and insecticides for the production of these grains.  He wants to increase his production and therefore improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and insecticides.

loans.name: German

texts.es: El Sr. Germán  tiene 21 años,  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil,  el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Germán va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Germán  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar  herramientas de trabajo ya que las que tiene que renovar, el Sr. Germán es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Germán, 21, works in construction and home remodeling.  He’s a bricklayer who lives in El Torno.  This loan will be his first sequence within the institution and Germán will use the loan to buy a motorcycle that will make it possible for him to do his work more efficiently because he has contracts to fulfill and he’ll be able to move about more quickly to his various construction sites which are far and he has long distances to cover to get to.  His reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving at work.  Germán will use profits to buy work tools that he has to replace.  Germán is a very hardworking man who feels happy about the opportunity provided by granting this loan since it’s the only activity he has to support himself with.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Leonza Marina

texts.es: Leonza Marina de 60 anos de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Chinandega se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial productiva. Leonza tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consiste en vender ropa como pantalones, faldas, blusas, vestidos, ropa interior. El cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante, ella tiene 12 anos de tener el negocio. Leonza siempre se ha caracteriza por se un mujer trabajadora, responsable, buena paga en tiempo y forma, todos los créditos anteriores han sido para invertir en capital de trabajo. Lo cual le ha ayudado a mantenerse en el negocio divido a la  competencia. Con el financiamiento comprara mercadería como: pantalones, vestidos, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, juegos de sabanas. Leonza agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un fuente de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Leonza Marina, 60, is a single mother of three adult children.  She’s from Chinandega Department, a place in the western part of the country.  Chinandega is noted for being a productive commercial zone.  Leonza’s economic activity is selling general merchandise like clothes (pants, skirts, blouses, dresses and underwear).  She sells both at home and from place to place.  She’s been in business 12 years.  She’s always been noted for being a hardworking, responsible woman who makes her payments as scheduled.  All her previous loans have been to invest in working capital that’s helped her stay in business despite the competition.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like pants, dresses, skirts, blouses, underwear and sets of bed linen.  Leonza thanks Kiva lenders for helping people of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bed linens.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 62 years old and married, the mother of ten children from Trinidad, Bohol. 

She is engaged in dressmaking and repair of clothes and bags. She has been in this business for more than 20 years now.

Maxima is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for her sewing machine, like nuts, screws and others, and to pay the school fees of her children.

Maxima believes that this loan will allow her to continue in her sewing business. Moreover, she aims to explore other lucrative venturesw to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her sewing machine and pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Gladis Ubel

texts.es:
La  Señora  Gladis   es una persona muy emprendedora  vive con su  esposo  y 3  hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una chiclera y venta de  cosméticos  Doña Gladis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: cosméticos como lociones, cremas, galletas, dulces, churos etc. Con el préstamo, ella espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más productos o mercancía  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan a diario, de  esta manera  cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes  y con estos ingresos  mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia.
Doña Gladis en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en  una pulpería  fuerte y reconocida de la zona y  para poder  darles  el  estudio que  sus hijos  necesitan  para  que sean personas  de  bien y con mayores oportunidades.
Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre  2012
texts.en:
Gladis is a very entrepreneurial person who lives with her husband and three children in the southern part of Honduras.  Her business is a snack shop and a cosmetics store.  

Gladis needs this loan to buy cosmetics like lotions and beauty creams, and cookies, candies, churros (a fried snack), etc.  With the loan, she hopes that her sales will increase at her store because she will have more products and merchandise to offer her customers when they visit each day.  Thus, she will meet her customers' needs and with her income she will improve her own family's lifestyle.

Gladis hopes that in the next few years her business will continue to grow and will become a large and well-known grocery store in her neighborhood so that she can give her children the schooling they need to become good people and have more opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras –  October,  2012

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as lotions and creams, and also cookies, sweets, fritters, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Emelda

texts.es:
La señora María de 48 años es soltera,  vive con sus hijos en su casa de habitación, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 11 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería como ser: frescos, churros, pollo, embutidos, granos básicos y mas, Ella radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña María esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotaría como maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, Maseca, embutidos, huevos, jabón, leche, pan, café y otros productos de consumo, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio ya que desea comprar  estos productos para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de navidad en donde se vende bastante.
Doña María su sueño es tener una buena pulpería.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
María, 48, lives with her children in her own house.  For the last 11 years she’s been in the business of selling groceries like fruit drinks, snacks, chicken, canned goods, basic grains and others.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in south Honduras.

María’s requesting the loan to buy groceries like corn, beans, rice, sugar, Maseca [corn flour], canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, bread, coffee and other consumer goods.  With support from this loan she intends to cover the business’ financial need because she needs to buy these products to stock the store because the Christmas season is approaching when sales are very good.  María’s dream is to have a good grocery store.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.es:
Cañaveral es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 6 mujeres alegres y amables, este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Palma Cuata el cual se encuentra rodeado por sembradíos de caña azúcar y su gente se dedica al trabajo en el campo.

Doña Francisca tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio la primaria y esta casada con  don Mariano que trabaja como jornalero, como no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando su madre le enseño a trabajar en las labores del hogar y un poco mas tarde le enseñaron a bordar y tejer, cuando aprendió a realizar esta actividad solo hacia blusas para ella y tejía sus propias servilletas pero cuando salia a caminar a la calle las señoras veían sus blusas y siempre le preguntaban donde las había comprado o mondado hacer así que decidió  iniciar a hacer sus manualidades para venderlas con sus amigos, vecinos y así ganar un poco de dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los  gastos de su hogar, actualmente también vende refrescos desde su hogar y ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  hilos, listones, telas, agujas, ganchos, zuelas y refrescos para continuar con sus ventas. ella espera ganar mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Martha venta de calzado,
Noemi molino de maíz,
Rubí venta de abarrotes, 
Daniela venta de calzado,
Guadalupe venta de refrescos
texts.en:
“Cañaveral” is the name of a group consisting of six cheerful, kind women.  The group is located in the community of Palma Cuata that’s surrounded by sugarcane fields; its residents work in the fields.

Francisca, 45, went to elementary school and she’s married to Mariano who works as a day laborer.  Since she did not have the opportunity to continue with her schooling her mother taught her how to do household chores and later on taught her to embroider and to knit.  When she learned this activity she only made blouses for herself and knitted her own napkins but when she’d go out into the street women would admire her blouses and would ask where she’d bought them or had them made so she decided to start making her crafts to sell among her friends and neighbors thus earning a bit of money to help her husband with household expenses.  She currently also sells soft-drinks from home and has requested this loan to buy thread, ribbon, fabric, needles, hooks, soles and soft-drinks to continue selling.  She hopes to win over more customers so that her profits will increase and be able to have a better quality of life.

The other group members are:
Martha - shoe sales,
Noemi - corn mill,
Rubí - grocery sales, 
Daniela - shoe sales,
Guadalupe - soft-drink sales.

loans.use: to buy thread, ribbon, fabric, needles, hooks, soles and soft-drinks.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: El Lindero Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Corrales existe un grupo que lleva por nombre El Lindero, ellos han decidido llamarlo así porque las reuniones se realizan en un pequeño rancho que lleva este nombre, el cual se ubica a orilla de la carretera a solo 5 minutos de la comunidad. Este grupo esta integrado por 9 personas cada uno de ellos tiene una actividad económica la cual se mencionan a continuación:

Florencia venta de pollo
Liliana venta de ropa
Cecilia venta de perfumes
Jorge venta de frutas y legumbres
Gregoria venta de refrescos 
Agustina venta de cosméticos 
Elodia venta de antojitos 
Gabriela venta de calzado
Lucrecia venta de ropa 


Jorge es uno de los miembros de este grupo y nos platica que el trabaja como jornalero pero hace un poco mas de un año decidió emprender su propio negocio ya que actualmente ningún dinero alcanza y tenia que sacar a delante a su familia y pagar la escuela de sus pequeños hijos, así que se puso a pensar en cual seria el negocio que hacia falta en su comunidad y que le dejaría una ganancia el cual también pudieran atender su esposa e hijos, así que después de mucho buscar decidió abrir un pequeño puesto en su hogar de venta de frutas y verduras, el esta muy contento ya que su negocio le esta dando buenos resultados y poco a poco lo va surtiendo mas, el también compra mojarra en la laguna que esta cerca de su comunidad  y revende  en las comunidades cercanas cuando no hay trabajo en el campo. Don Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador y que quiere que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In the community of Corrales, there is a group that calls itself El Lindero because it holds its meetings on a ranch with that name. The ranch is beside the road just five minutes from the village. The group has nine members, each of whom earns a living with a different economic activity:
Florencia sells poultry.
Liliana sells clothing.
Cecilia sells perfumes.
Jorge sells fruits and vegetables.
Gregoria sells soft drinks.
Agustina sells cosmetics.
Elodia sells snacks.
Gabriela sells shoes.
Lucrecia sells clothing.
Jorge is one of the members of this group. He tells us that he works as an agricultural worker but a little over a year ago decided to start his own business since he wasn't making enough money to support his family. He wants to give his family a better life and pay for his children's schooling, so he started thinking about what business was lacking in his community that would make a profit and that his wife and children could help him run. After a lot of thinking, he decided to open a small stand in his home to sell fruits and vegetables. He is very happy because his business is doing well and gradually expanding. He also buys bream at a lake near his village and sells it in nearby villages when there's no work in the fields. Jorge is a hardworking man who wants to give his children a better quality of life and see them continue their studies.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gs Nueva Jutiapa Group

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria y la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y reparación de las mismas, el cuenta con mas 10 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Don Juan es una persona muy trabajadora, el cuenta con  la clientela de la zona y de las personas de las montañas cercanas a su comunidad, a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, el se ha sabido ganar la clientela porque su manera de atenderlos es muy especial y es una persona muy querida en su comunidad.
Don Juan con el préstamo comprara llantas, cadenas, rines, manecillas, cables, arroz, maíz, manteca, jabón, detergente, aceite, frescos, pan, café, huevos etc. esto le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y  una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Don Juan sueña con tener un taller con todos los implementos necesarios.
Don Danilo, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería), y el destazo de reses, el cuenta con 8 años de experiencia.
Don Jorge, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería), cuenta con 3 años de experiencia.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a merchant whose main business activity is selling groceries, but he also performs bicycle repairs and sells the respective spare parts.  He has been in business for more than 10 years.  Don Juan is a hardworking individual and his clientele are from the area and include people who live in the mountains near his community.  Through his business, he has been able to move forward since it is one his main sources of income.  He knows how to attract customers because he gives them special attention.  As a result, he is well-liked in the community.

Don Juan will use his loan to buy tires, chains, rims, handles, cables, rice, corn, lard, soap, detergent, oil, soft drinks, bread, coffee, eggs, and other items.  This will enable him to have a better business.  As a result, he will be able to cover his household expenses and provide a better quality of life for his family.  Don Juan dreams of having a workshop with all of the necessary equipment.

The other members are as follows:
•	Don Danilo is a merchant whose main business activity is selling groceries and butchered cows.  He has eight years of experience.
•	Don Jorge is a merchant who also has a grocery store.  He has three years of experience.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - October 2012

loans.use: to buy tires, chains, rims, handles, cables, rice, corn, lard, soap, detergent, oil, soft drinks, bread, coffee, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Fifonsi 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Wassilatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Wassilatou est âgée de 52 ans et est une veuve. Wassilatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Wassilatou est mère de deux enfants, dont aucun n’est scoarisé et dont tous sont à sa charge. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de sa famille, Wassilatou vend depuis dix ans des friperies de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Wassilatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Wassilatou sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI 2.
texts.en:
FIFONSI 2 is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from Alidé in order to raise the level of its activity.

The group's representative, Wassilatou, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. She is 52 years old and a widow.  She has not attended school.  She is the mother of two children who do not go to school and are her dependents.

In order to provide for her family, Wassilatou has been selling used clothing for ten years, working as an itinerant seller.  This activity allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She stocks up at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover and income, Wassilatou is requesting a first loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the FIFONSI 2 group.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra del Carmen vive junto a su compañero de vida  de cuarenta y dos años de edad y sus hijos; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con este trabajo y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener los mejores resultados, su  negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y frecuentada por las personas de la comunidad, es muy conocida pues sus tortillas son las mas ricas y siempre están calientitas, tiene mucha clientela y la buscan por su excelente calidad, buenos precios y sobre todo el servicio mas rápido; Sandra es una mujer luchadora, entregada a su labor, su mas grande meta es alcanzar el triunfo y se esfuerza día con día para ganarse ese futuro mas próspero; en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar su inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc. Sandra del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de otras instituciones y se hace responsable del pago completo de la deuda, y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Sandra del Carmen lives with her life companion who is 42-years-old and with their children.  She works selling tortillas.  She’s been in this business for several years and has gained much experience that makes it possible for her to obtain the best results.  Her business is located in a very strategic spot that’s visited by the people in the community.  She’s very well-known because her tortillas are the most delicious and they are always nice and hot.  She has many customers who seek her out because of the excellent quality, good prices and quick service.  Sandra is a tenacious woman who is dedicated to her work.  Her greatest goal is to attain success and she strives daily to secure a more prosperous future.  

Demand has increased in recent months and she wants to take advantage of it to increase her investment but she does not have enough capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, etc.  Sandra del Carmen has good payment references from other institutions and she will be completely responsible for the debt; she hopes too to be able to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and to buy propane.

loans.name: Brisas De Leones Group

texts.es:
María Orbelina tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una aldea que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. A ella le ha gustado el comercio, inicio vendiendo mercadería como ropa y otros, y hace 10 años decidió por dedicarse a la cría de cerdos para venderlos y es la actividad actual la que le genera sus propios ingresos. Su mercado está en la misma comunidad. Actualmente cuenta con 5 animales para engorde. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo en forma grupal, el grupo se llama Brisas de Leones y está formado por 8 miembros que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda de blusa Blanca esta María Orbelina, luego  sigue María Deysy, Eusebio, Elvira, Jose, Mirian, Maribel y Nelly a la derecha. Todos viven en la misma comunidad,  7 de los miembros se dedican al cultivo de frijoles y maíz y ella se dedica a la  cría de credos. El préstamo total grupal que solicitan es por 52,000 lempiras y lo van a invertir en la asistencia al cultivo de maíz y frijoles para sacar mejores cosechas y en la compra de concentrado, vacunas, arreglo de corral para crianza y engorde de cerdos para mejorar el cuidado que requieren. 
María Orbelina tiene como meta hacer dos corrales mas para aumentar la cantidad de cerdos.
texts.en:
María Orbelina, 36, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in a village belonging to Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  She’s always liked commerce.  She started out selling merchandise like clothes and others and ten years ago decided to start raising pigs to sell and this is her current source of income.  Her market is in her same community and she currently has five animals she’s fattening up.  She’s requesting this loan as a group loan.  

The group is called “Brisas de Leones” and it has 8 members who appear in the photo thus: on the left, wearing a white blouse is María Orbelina, next is María Deysy, Eusebio, Elvira, José, Mirian, Maribel and Nelly on the right.  They all live in the same community.  Seven of the members grow beans and corn and she raises pigs.  The total group loan is for 52,000 Lempiras and they will invest it in the corn and bean crops to attain better crop yields and in the purchase of animal feed, vaccines and to repair the corrals to improve the care the pigs need while they grow.  María Orbelina’s goal is to build two more corrals to increase the number of pigs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, vaccines and to repair the corral gates.

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than eleven years now. Her husband also works as a farmer.

Pedra gives her best in helping her husband in tilling their farm lot.

Pedra aims to make their farming business a success, but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, they will be able to produce a good quality harvest, thus improving their yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a 51-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming with her husband for more than 20 years. It is the source of the family's income.

Prima works hard to help her husband in meeting the family's needs, especially for the children's schooling. Prima is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the crops so that they will be able to grow and harvest a good quality of rice. In the future, Prima wants to expand their business and explore new ventures to augment their earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the crops

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa sells secondhand clothing at Nkrontrodo near Elmina. She has done this for three years. She is married with three children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay the utility bills. 

Adwoa needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwoa will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mrs. Salma, is a war survivor and dedicated entrepreneur who lives in the highlands of Aceh, Indonesia. Her father and brother were killed during the Acehnese civil war and the shop of her family was burnt down. The sales of Nazava Water Filters offer a great opportunity for her and her husband to increase their daily income. 

In just 6 months Salma sold over 300 water filters and provided over 1500 people with access to safe and affordable drinking water. Most of Salma’s customers are poor to lower income coffee farmers that earn less than 5 USD per day. Compared to buying water households save 132 USD per year using Nazava Water Filters, which enable them to purify rain, well or river water and make it safe to drink. 

To respond to the high demand for Nazava water filters in her district, Salma would like to purchase bigger stock at reduced costs. She has already established a network of 5 sub-resellers that can directly sell the filters to their customers. “I currently have the cash for just 25 filters, that’s why I run out of stock easily, which is bad for my business. Transport costs are also relatively high when ordering just a few filters. “ With a 2000 USD loan, Ibu Salma can provide safe drinking water to 1000 people in just 1 month. The loan enables her to purchase around 200 water filters at a discounted price and with reduced transportation costs. This will provide more families with safe drinking water, increase their disposable income as well as the revenue for Salma

loans.use: to purchase a bigger stock of water filters and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in her district.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
El Mirador es el nombre de un grupo de hombres y mujeres trabajadores y alegres cada una de ellos tiene una actividad económica, Ellos decidieron poner este nombre a su grupo para identificar mas rápido de que comunidad son ya que su comunidad se llama El Mirador, la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de caña y la recolección de hule.

Don Cleto es uno de los integrantes de este grupo el tiene la edad de 55 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casado con la señora Martha,actualmente vive solo con su esposa ya que sus hijos están casados, cuando era pequeño no había muchas escuelas y en su comunidad solo daban clases de primaria, si querían seguir estudiando tenían que salir a otros pueblos y los gastos eran mayores así que tuvo que aprender a trabajar en el campo,  con su trabajo y esfuerzo hace un poco mas de 15 años adquirió su propia parcela y actualmente se dedica a trabajar su tierra el siembra y cultiva  caña de azúcar aunque solo se cultiva una vez al año le deja buenas ganancias con las cuales ha sacado adelante a su familia  en los últimos años. Con un préstamo de Vision Fund don Cleto podar comprar abonos y fertilizantes. el dijo "el trabajo de campo es duro pero muy bonito cuando vez tu siembra bien grande y lista para cortarla, mas saber que por mi caña la procesan y se convierte en la azúcar que todos los días consumimos"

el espera que con esta inversión su caña cresca mas grande y fuerte para que deje buenas ganancias y no les falte nada a su familia.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:
 Reyna venta de abarrotes, 
 Brigida recolección de hule, 
Marcelino cultivo de caña, 
Javier cultivo de caña y
 Demetria cultivo de caña.
texts.en:
“El Mirador” (The Lookout) is the name of this group of hardworking, cheerful men and women each with their own economic activity.  They decided to name their group thus to more quickly identify the community they’re from since it’s called “El Mirador.”  The main economic activity is growing sugarcane and collecting rubber.

Cleto, 55, is one of the group members.  He only completed primary school and he’s married to Martha.  He currently lives only with his wife since his children are all married.  When he was little there weren’t too many schools in his community and only elementary school classes were available.  If one wanted to continue going to school one had to leave and go to other towns and this was very costly so he had to learn how to work in the fields.  With his work and effort he was able to buy his own parcel of land a little over 15 years ago and he currently works his land growing sugarcane.  Even though sugarcane is only harvested once a year it produces good profits he’s used to support his family the last few years.

With a Vision Fund loan, Cleto will be able to buy manure and fertilizer.  He said: “Working in the fields is hard but very rewarding when you see that your crop is big and ready for cutting even more so knowing that my sugarcane will be processed to become the sugar we all consume daily.”  He hopes that with this new investment his sugarcane will grow bigger and stronger so that it will produce good profits and his family will have no unmet needs.

The other group members are:
 
Reyna - sells groceries, 
Brigida - collects rubber, 
Marcelino - grows sugarcane, 
Javier - grows sugarcane, and
Demetria - grows sugarcane.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Mu´ssha Group

texts.es: Josefa tiene 67 años de edad es viuda, vive sola y es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy alegre ella pertenece a un pueblo indígena llamado Francisco Serrato donde todavía predomina la cultura mazahua, ella es parte del grupo llamado Mussha. Dice que hicieron este grupo porque varias de las personas querían emprender sus propios negocios ya que la gente en los pueblos grandes no les dan trabajo debido a su condición de ser de comunidad ella dice “la gente de las ciudades abeces nos discrimina porque hablamos nuestro dialecto y porque nos vestimos con faldones de colores y no nos quieren dar trabajos es por eso que pedimos mejor créditos para hacer nuestros propios negocios”. Dice que no estudio porque es huérfana desde muy pequeña y su abuela no le importaba que fuera a la escuela, dice que desde muy pequeña se enseño a bordar y a sembrar ya que tienen terrenos muy grandes donde la tierra es noble y da un maíz de muy buena calidad, ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces, frituras, refrescos jugos afuera de una escuela y del centro de salud de su población y dice que le va bien ya que nada mas son dos puestos que se ponen, los dulces los compra en una población cercana a la de ella donde le dan precios bajos y el refresco se lo llevan los carros de diferentes compañías refresqueras. Ahorita esta pidiendo un crédito porque quiere surtir su puestecito y también quiere comprar flores de cempasúchil y de terciopelo por que las quiere vender el día de muertos en su localidad, ya que años con año la gente de su comunidad va a las tumbas de sus difuntos y adornan con flores y con comida sus tumbas es por eso que ahorita le urge su préstamo para ir comprando lo necesario. Dice que las flores ira a comprarlas a una población que esta cerca de su comunidad donde se dedican a cultivar ese tipo de flores para la época de muertos. Dice que está muy contenta porque cree que le ira muy bien y agradecida con Visión Fund porque su vida a mejorado atravez de los créditos que ha pedido ya que con las ganancias ha estado comprando de una o dos laminas para mejorar su casita ya que es de madera y lamina de cartón. Los otros seis integrantes del grupo se llaman Venancio, Aurelia, Elpidio, Aurelia, María Eduviges y Yolanda ellos invertirán sus créditos  para una carpintería y comprar sus materiales que ocupa para hacer muebles, para un taller de costura comprara telas y material para hacer prendas de sus vestimentas indígenas, para surtir refresco que vende, para la compra de material para hacer bordados artesanales y para la compra de unos borregos para criarlos y después venderlos.
texts.en:
Josefa, 67, is a widow.  She lives alone and is a very hardworking, very cheerful woman who belongs to an indigenous town called Francisco Serrato where the Mazahua culture still predominates.  She’s part of the group called “Mussha.”  She says that they formed this group because several of the people wanted to start business of their own because people in the big towns wouldn’t hire them because they came from indigenous communities.  “People in the cities sometimes discriminate against us because we speak our own dialect and dress in traditional, multi-colored skirts and they don’t want to hire us which is why we are asking for loans to set up our own businesses,” she says.  

She says that she did not go to school because she’s been an orphan since she was very little and her grandmother didn’t care one way or the other if she went to school or not.  She says that she taught herself to embroider when she was very little and also how to plant since she has large parcels of land with very fertile soil that produces very good quality corn.

She has a business selling candy, fast-food snacks, soft-drinks and juice outside a school and her town’s health center and she says that she does well since there are just two stands there.  She buys the candy in a nearby town where she finds low prices and the soft-drinks are delivered to her by the various soft-drink company delivery trucks.

Right now she’s asking for a loan because she wants to stock her stand and also wants to sell marigolds and velvet to sell in her community for the Day of the Dead since year after year residents in her community visit the graves of their departed and decorate them with flowers and food which is why the loan is urgently needed now so she can buy everything she needs.

She says that she’ll go buy the flowers in a town near her community that specializes in growing this type of flower used for Day of the Dead.  She says that she’s very happy because she thinks she’ll do very well.  She’s grateful to Vision Fund because her life has been improving thanks to the loans she’s requested because with profits obtained she’s been buying one or two sheets of metal to make improvements in her little house because it’s made of wood and pasteboard.

The other six members of the group are Venancio, Aurelia, Elpidio, Aurelia, María Eduviges and Yolanda.  They will invest their loans in a carpentry shop buying supplies to manufacture furniture, in a sewing shop buying fabric and supplies to make traditional indigenous costumes, to stock up on soft-drinks to sell, to buy supplies to do artisanal embroidery and to buy some goats to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to buy marigolds, candy, soft-drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Don Emiliano es cliente de la institución desde hace varios meses, es una persona aún muy joven con muchas ganas de superarse. Don Emiliano tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria,  está casado con la señora Azucena desde hace 19 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que asisten a la escuela, el señor Emiliano tiene una imprenta donde da servicio a las personas que necesitan alguna impresión, estampados, invitaciones, rútulos de publicidad etc. “Yo inicie desde abajo ya que estuve empleado 16 años también en una imprenta pero quise iniciar mi propio negocio donde yo manejara mis horarios y mi trabajo, ya contaba con la experiencia necesaria solo necesitaba decidirme e iniciar”. Don Emiliano desde muy temprano abre su local para dar el servicio lo mejor que puede. Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para comprar una maquina de impresión offset y algunas piezas para maquina, pulpa para imprimir en serigrafía, plancha para secado y equipo para diseño que le hacía falta ya que sin esta máquina no podría dar un buen servicio. Él siempre trata de mantener a su clientela contenta y afortunadamente no le va mal en su negocio “Me gustaría que mi negocio me ayudara a solventar los gastos de la educación de mis hijos me encantaría verlos graduados en alguna profesión, estoy muy agradecido con la institución ya que gracias a anteriores préstamos pude hacer crecer mi negocio como comprando mas material que me hacia falta, ahora ya puedo hacer mas trabajos como playeras estampadas, recetas medicas, invitaciones, lonas etc.”
texts.en:
Mr. Emiliano, has been a client of the institution for some months now. He is still a young person with a strong will to get ahead in life. Mr. Emiliano is forty years old. He finished high school and he has been married to Mrs. Azucena for nineteen years. They have a family, composed of three children that go to school. Mr. Emiliano has a printing workshop where he sells printing services (both on paper and on clothes), invitations, flyers, etc.

Mr. Emiliano says, ”I started from scratch, since I was and employee in a printing workshop myself for sixteen years, but I wanted to start my own business in order to be able to manage my own time and work. I had the experience that was required, so I just needed to make the decision and start this printing business.”

Mr. Emiliano opens his workshop very early and provides the best service possible. He is requesting the loan to buy an offset printer and some components for a machine, a screen printing machine, an iron for drying and some design equipment he was missing. Without this machine he would not be able to provide a good service.

He tries to keep his customers satisfied. Fortunately, he does well with his business. If things continue as they are, he would like to expand his business, saying: “I would like the business to be profitable enough to help me pay for my children’s education; I would love to see them getting a professional degree. I deeply appreciate the help of the institution, since with previous loans I have been able to expand my business, by buying more material that I was lacking. Now, I can provide more services, like printed t-shirts, medical prescription forms, invitations, canvas, etc.”

loans.use: to buy an offset printer, some components for a machine, a screen printing machine, an iron for drying and design equipment.

loans.name: Meloma Group

texts.es: El grupo Meloma está conformado por 8 mujeres muy trabajadoras ellas viven en una comunidad hermosa donde la gente aun conversa en su lengua materna, platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque así se llama su pueblo solo que esta en su lengua materna llamada Mazahua. Doña Francisca quien es la representante del grupo platica que tiene 47 años de edad esta casada con el señor José juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cual tres son dependientes, Doña Mago, como de cariño le dicen, platica que se dedica a la venta de guajolotes (pavos) desde hace ya 18 años. Ella aprendió la actividad de sus padres porque también se dedicaban a la crianza de animales como los guajolotes, pero también antes tenia pollos y borregos aunque considera que no era buena opción entonces fue como se quedo con sus guajolotes. Actualmente solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar cuatro guajolotes más, la única dificultad a la cual se enfrenta Doña Mago es cuando sus guajolotes enferman y mueren muchas veces pierde su ganancia y la inversión que hizo al comprarlos. Doña Mago Comenta “No importa, seguiré echándole ganas para poder ayudar a mi hijo que esta por concluir su preparatoria y me gustaría que siguiera estudiando y que tuviera una carrera aunque para esto necesito tener muchos más animales y sé que con el crédito de la institución y Kiva lo lograré”. Las integrantes del grupo son Dulce, Francisca, Genoveva, María Guadalupe, María, María Luisa quienes invertirán en becerros; mientras que María Guadalupe comprará pollos para engorda.
texts.en:
The “Melom” group comprises 8 very hardworking women who live in a beautiful community where people still converse in their native tongue.  They relate that the group name was chosen because that’s the name of their town but in the Mazahua mother tongue.

Francisca, who is the group representative, relates that’s she’s been married to José for 47 years.  They formed a family of seven children three of which are still dependent.  “Doña Mago” as she’s affectionately referred to relates that she’s been selling turkeys for 18 years having learned from her parents who worked raising animals like turkeys.  She also used to have chickens and sheep but didn’t consider them to be good options so that’s why she stayed with turkeys and why she’s asking for a new loan to buy four more turkeys.

The only difficulty Doña Mago has is when the turkeys get sick and die.  She often loses her profit and the investment she made when she bought them.  Doña Mago comments: “It doesn’t matter.  I will continue striving to help my son who is about to complete high-school and I’d like him to continue studying and have a career.  To do so, though, I’m going to have to have quite a few more animals and I know that with a Kiva loan I’ll be succeed.”

The other group members are: Dulce, Francisca, Genoveva, María Guadalupe, María and María Luisa who will invest in goats and María Guadalupe who will buy chicks to raise.

loans.use: to buy turkeys.

loans.name: Ana Rufina

texts.es: Ana Rufina reside junto a su madre que es la única persona que vive y la acompaña en su vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser ejemplo para sus vecinos quienes admiran su vida ya que lo da todo por brindarle el mejor bienestar a su madre. Actualmente y gracias a su esfuerzo diario posee un negocio de venta de tortillas, pupusas y deliciosos platos típicos entre semana y es así como ella honradamente se gana la vida y tiene para que en su mesa no falte el pan de cada día. Ana siente el deseo de poder incrementar mas su negocio y a su vez generar mas ganancias pero no posee el capital para llevar a cabo tal acción, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para que pueda comprar los insumos para llevar a cabo tal acción desea comprar: tomates, chile verde, maíz, frijol, chicharrón, sal, azúcar, repollo entre otros, para así tener mas contentos a los clientes que la prefieren por su manera de ser y atenderlos. Cabe destacar que tiene buenas referencias de pago y esto la hace que sea una mujer que siempre busca lo mejor para ella y por quienes la rodean y agradece por la ayuda que está solicitando sea brindada.
texts.en:
Ana Rufina lives with her mother; she’s the only person who lives with her and shares her life.  She’s a very hard-working woman who has always been noted for setting an example for her neighbors who admire her life since she gives her all for her mother’s wellbeing.  Currently and thanks to her daily efforts, she owns a shop where she sells tortillas, pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] and delicious traditional dishes during the week which is how she earns an honest living and has what she needs so that her table never lacks daily bread.

Ana wants to be able to increase her business while generating higher profits but does not have capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy ingredients to carry out said plan.  She wants to buy tomatoes, green chilies, corn, beans, pork, salt, sugar and cabbage, among others to keep her customers happy who prefer her for the way she is and how she treats them.  It’s worth mentioning that she has good payment references and this makes her a woman who is always looking for the best for her and her loved ones.  She is thankful that the help she’s requesting will be granted.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green chilies, corn, beans, pork, salt, sugar and cabbage, among others.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 49 years old.. He is married to a farmer. He has spent 19 years in farming. 

He would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor, instead of using human labor.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Lara Group

texts.en:
The Lara group consists of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They have taken out a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Karima, 30 years old, is a very hardworking person who lives with her four children. They help her with her perfume and incense sales business that she started 6 years ago. Karima's business has great clients. She needs a youth loan to buy more perfumes and incense. Karima hopes that this financing will increase her sales, as she will be able to buy a variety of products to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and incense for her business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is a 30-year-old married man and the father of a one-year-old from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a fisherman who has also been engaged in a seaweed farming business for more than three years as his source of income.

Victoriano aims to expand his business but lacks the financial resources to do so. He is asking for a loan to buy straw and rope for seaweed farming and fuel for the fishing boat. In the future, Victoriano wants to make his seaweed and fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for his daughter's future schooling.

loans.use: to buy straw and rope for seaweed farming and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a small trader.  She sells foodstuffs like tubers of yams at Nkontrodo near Elmina. Her husband is a driver. They have four dependants. 

Mary has been in this business for some time now.  She wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers, so a loan from Kiva will be used to buy tubers of yams and other foodstuffs and vegetables to sell. 

She hopes to use the new profits  to expand her business.

loans.use: buy tubers of yams and other foodstuffs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is a petty trader.  Some of the items she trades in are tomatoes, pepper, onions, salt, cassavas, and plantains.  Ama has been into this business for five years now. 

She is married to a driver and has four children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  

Ama needs this loan to purchase more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassavas, plantains, and other food items for sale. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, cassavas, plantains, and other food items for sale.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Don Rosalio es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable siempre muy amable con todas las personas. El señor Rosalio es cliente de la institución, tiene 39 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Rosario desde hace 7 años, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que asisten a la escuela. Don Rosalio tiene un taller mecánico en el municipio de San Felipe “Yo inicié mi negocio porque me gusta mucho arreglar los carros y ver que mis clientes se van muy contentos porque sus carros ha quedado muy bien, sin embargo para lograr tener un buen trabajo con los autos de los clientes tuve que estudiar y aún sigo asistiendo a cursos”. A Don Rosalio le encantaba mucho la idea de poner su propio negocio entonces se decidió y desde hace 15 años ha estado dando sus servicios en su taller mecánico, en el cual también participan sus hermanos. La dificultad que presenta el taller de don Rosalio es la falta de herramientas más sofisticadas para realizar un mejor trabajo, es por eso que solicita un crédito a la institución para ver si puede comprar el equipo que le hace falta, así como algunas refacciones para autos. “Estoy muy agradecido con VisionFund y con Kiva por la oportunidad de obtener un crédito ya que me servirá de mucho porque podré comprar lo que me hace falta en mi taller mecánico, también gracias al crédito podre llegar a en mi propio espacio y en donde no tenga que pagar renta ya que el lugar donde tengo mi taller es un lugar rentado y me gustaría que fuera mas grande ya que si mi negocio crece satisfactoriamente para mi será mas fácil solventar los gastos educativos de mis hijos y ver algún día que se gradúan como profesionistas”.
texts.en:
Rosalío is a very hardworking, responsible man who is always very kind to people.  Rosalío is a client of the institution.  He’s 39-years-old, and married to Rosario for seven years.  They have formed a family together and have three children attending school.

Rosalío has an auto repair shop in the town of San Felipe.  He says, “Well, I started my business because I like repairing cars very much and seeing my customers leave happy because their cars have been repaired well.  However, in order to do good work on customer cars I had to take courses and still take them.”  

Rosalío was very keen on opening his own shop and for the last fifteen years he has been providing auto repair services in his shop.  The shop is called “El Niño” and his brothers work there with him.
