The difficulty the shop has is lack of more sophisticated tools to do better work which is why he’s requesting a loan from the institution to see if he can buy the tools he needs and some auto spare parts.

Rosalío makes this statement: “I am very grateful to Vision Fund and to Kiva for the granted loan because it will be very useful for me because I’ll be able to buy what I need for my auto shop.  Also, thanks to the loan I will be able to have my own space and not have to pay rent since I rent my shop’s current location.  I’d also like it to be bigger because if my business grows satisfactorily it will be easier to pay for my children’s schooling and someday see them graduate as professionals.”

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Enedino

texts.es: Enedino se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 32 años, aunque desde que era pequeño aprendió todo lo relacionado con este oficio al lado de su padre. Él está casado con Genoveva y tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son solteros y aún viven con él y lo ayudan en las labores del campo. Para la siguiente cosecha Enedino necesita un crédito para pagar a los cortadores que contratará para que trabajen en sus fincas. Además de producir café Enedino también es un productor de caña y nos cuenta que produce hasta 80 toneladas anuales de caña de azúcar. Pasando la cosecha a Enedino le gustaría arreglar la cocina de su casa y también invertir un poco de dinero en la caña.
texts.en: Enedino has worked producing coffee for 32 years.  Since he was young he learned everything about this work at his father's side.  He is married to Genoveva and they have five children, of whom four are single and live with them and help with the field work.  For the next harvest, Enedino needs to a loan to pay the cutters he will hire to work on his land.  In addition to producing coffee, Enedino also produces sugar cane.  He says that he produces 80 tons of sugar cane each year.  After the harvest, Enedino would like to make improvements to the kitchen in his house and also invest some money in sugar cane.

loans.use: to pay laborers who will cut coffee.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
La señora María, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestro de Primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Larreynaga  dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 27 años, es soltera con 1 hijo al que está apoyando en sus estudios Universitarios, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  María  atraviesa, es de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que esta en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Tablas, Clavo, Alambre de amarre, hierro, cemento, ladrillos de pared, arena y mano de obra., para  realizar el levantamiento de la pared , piso del cuarto y acera,  para mayor seguridad de su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo.
Es importante destacar la importancia de la misma, y le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo del financiamiento oportuno para resolver su necesidad.
texts.en:
Maria has worked arduously as a grade school teacher in a small, local high school in Larreynaga. She has worked as a teacher for 27 years, she is single and has one son who she is supporting through university studies. One of the needs that Maria faces is improving the condition of her home as it is currently in poor shape. For this reason she made the decision to turn to CEPRODEL to request a loan for purchasing building materials such as boards, nails, tie wire, rebar, cement, floor and wall bricks, sand, and to pay for labor in order to construct a wall, a floor in one room, and a walkway. This will increase the security of her home and thereby bring much improved living conditions for her son. 
It's important to underline this last point, and Maria is grateful to CEPRODEL for the financial assistance provided in resolving this issue.

loans.use: to purchase boards, nails, tie wire, rebar, cement, brick for floors and walls, sand, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Doña Daysi, es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a vender ropa usada, actividad que ejerce desde hace quince años.
Ella también se dedica a la compra y venta de desechos plásticos para ser reciclado.
Sin embargo para esta temporada navideña son los que ella necesita para comprar una paca para niños, y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Es una persona trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante, y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo, el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Daysi is a small businesswoman who sells used clothing.  She has been in this line of work for 15 years.  Daysi also buys and sells discarded plastics for recycling.  

For this Christmas season, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a bale of children’s clothing so that she can improve her earnings.  Daysi is a hardworking person who wants to succeed and have the support of her son.  

The loan will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used children's clothing.

loans.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe  Dushirukumwete et habite à Gitega. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Elias, un commerçant de vin de banane. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de vin de banane depuis  20 ans.

Elle est à son onzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bananes pour préparer  beaucoup de litres de vin de banane ,à vendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle  espère réaliser de grands  profits.Elle va s’acheter une grande propriété foncière et se doter d’un bon logement.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Dushirukumwete group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 38 years old and married to Elias, a banana wine seller.  They have three children together.

Jacqueline has been selling banana wine for 20 years.

This is her eleventh loan with Turame.  With the loan obtained from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make many liters of banana wine for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, she hopes to make large profits.  She plans to buy a large piece of land and have a nice house to live in.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make many liters of banana wine for resale.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Desde pequeño Gonzalo ha trabajado en el campo. Comenzó cuando tenía 10 años con su padre produciendo caña de azúcar y cuando Gonzalo tenía 15 años su padre comenzó a producir café y fue así como aprendió todo lo relacionado con este cultivo. Actualmente Gonzalo tiene 54 años y está casado con María y tienen 7 hijos. Gonzalo y María se dedican desde que se casaron a la producción de café y para la siguiente cosecha necesitan un crédito para realizar labores de limpieza y mantenimiento de sus fincas, así como para pagar a cortadores de café. Gonzalo esta realizando las labores necesarias para que la totalidad de su producción sea de café orgánico y ya solo falta que le den la certificación. Además del café Gonzalo también se dedica a la venta de productos de nutrición por catálogo desde hace 10 años, actividad que le ha servido como ingreso extra para su familia.
texts.en: Gonzalo has worked in the fields since he was little.  He started when he was 10-years-old helping his father grow sugarcane and when Gonzalo turned fifteen his father started growing coffee and that’s how he learned everything related to this crop.  Gonzalo is currently 54-years-old and married to María; they have 7 children.  Gonzalo and María have been growing coffee since they were married and need a loan for the next harvest to do the weeding and crop maintenance as well as to pay day laborers to pick the coffee beans.  Gonzalo is doing the necessary work to convert his entire production into organic coffee and all he needs now is the certification.  In addition to growing coffee, Gonzalo has also been selling nutritional products via catalogue for ten years, an activity that’s produced extra family income.

loans.use: to provide coffee crop maintenance and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su familia su esposo y su hijo, gracias a Dios viven en casa propia ya que con esfuerzo han hecho que poco a poco su calidad de vida mejore un poco más. Ana es un mujer luchadora que sus visiones siempre han sido  darlo todo por el bienestar de su hijo es responsable, honesta, sincera y trabajadora es muy amable y eso a ella le llena de orgullo ser una buena madre, esposa, amiga u otros. Ana posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos básicos y de primera necesidad como leche, huevos, papel higiénico u otros. La tienda está ubicada en su casa y gracias a la manera de atender a los clientes ella posee de clientela quienes son los que la buscan para comprarles productos a diario. Lastimosamente  ella no tiene el capital necesario para hacer que su tienda crezca un poco y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como: Sopas, café, maíz, frijol, Huevos, leche, pan dulce, chocolate u otros. La clienta cuenta con buenas referencias de pago y eso la hace que las personas depositen su confianza en ella, Confía en que Dios no la va a dejar sola y la ayuda pronto será entregada.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth, 38, lives with her husband and son.  Thanks to God they live in a house of their own since they’ve gradually improved their quality of life by means of their efforts.  Ana is a very tenacious woman who has always visualized giving her all for her son’s wellbeing.  She’s responsible, honest, sincere and hardworking; she’s very kind and it fills her with pride to be a good mother, wife, girlfriend, etc.

Ana has a small store where she sells basic items and staples like milk, eggs, toilet paper and others.  The store is located at home and thanks to the way she treats customers she has a clientele that seeks her out to buy from her every day.  Unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to make the store grow a bit and this is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy more raw materials like soups, coffee, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate and others.  She has good payment references and this makes people trust her.  She trusts in God that He will not abandoned her and that the requested help will soon be delivered.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
Ramonito is a 22-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is engaged in a food vending business selling native snack foods called "puto" (steamed cakes). He is also a fish pond operator.

Ramonito works hard to earn a living in order to support his family. He is in need of additional capital for his food vending business and is applying for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc. Ramonito dreams of making his business grow and become prosperous. He also wants to explore other ventures to enhance his income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage. With these items, she and her husband will be able to enhance their catch thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Vilma hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and buckets for storage

loans.name: Lillian Eliza

texts.es:
Estimados señores de kiva, presento ante ustedes a la señora lillian, una señora que por veinte años se ha dedicado a elaborar con sus propias manos un producto muy popular en la dieta de los nicaragüenses como son las tortillas suaves y tostadas.
El dinero lo invertirá para comprar maíz por quintales, ya que de esta forma ella disminuye los costos de producción de tortillas.
Con los ingresos que genera su actividad comercial contribuye para los gastos del hogar.
Su estado civil es acompañada, Es una persona honesta y trabajadora.
su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos;solicita un crédito a ceprodel con el que pretende  mejorar su actividad comercial y sus ingresos
texts.en:
Being presented to the Kiva lenders is Sra. Lillian.  For the past 20 years, she has devoted herself to making products that are very popular in the Nicaraguan diet – soft tortillas and tostadas.  The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of corn by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46 kilograms).  This will enable her to reduce her production costs for making tortillas.  

With the income she generates from her business activity, Lillian will be able to cover her household expenses.  She lives with her husband, and she is an honest and hardworking women.  Her husband works buying and selling seafood.  

She intends to use it to improve her business and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
En un bello Municipio de Santa Rosa Del Peñón Ubicada en el departamento de león una Preciosa ciudad dedicada a la agricultura, el comercio y la ganadería es donde habita la Señora Fidelina.
 
Fidelina necesita un financiamiento de Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de: Cemento, Arena y Pago de Mano de Obra  para la mejorar las condiciones de su casa, debido a que no la podido mejorar por sus bajos ingresos que únicamente recibe de lo poco que se gana. 

Fidelina no es profesional, pero si es una persona trabajadora donde le pone amor a su trabajo, trabaja como empleada doméstica ya que únicamente cuenta con este tipo de experiencia que lo obtuvo de su madre. 

De manera, solo cuenta con su honestidad, su buen record crediticio, su buena salud y su amor al trabajo, esto la hace a que pueda pagar el crédito solicitado. 

Con toda su honradez Agradezco Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le sigan financiando un buen crédito para ella seria de mucha importancia para el desarrollo y condiciones de su vida
texts.en:
In a beautiful town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, located in the province of Leon, a lovely city dedicated to agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding is where Ms. Fidelina resides.

Fidelina needs financing from Ceprodel and Kiva to buy cement, sand and labor needed to improve the condition of her house.  Due to low pay, the only income she receives is small and as a result, she has not been able to make the improvements.

Fidelina is not a professional, but she is hardworking and puts her heart in her work.  She works as housekeeper at a health center. It is the only type of experience she has, which she learned from her mother.

In a way, she only counts with her honesty; good credit record, good health and love for her work, which give her the ability to repay the loan.

She honestly would be grateful if Ceprodel and Kiva continued to finance her loan, which would be very important to her progress and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and labor.

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades ubicada en el departamento de León, el Joven Marlon José es conocida como una persona responsable, honesta y dedicada a trabajo.

Marlon José se Llama el joven de 38 años, nacido en este bello municipio, se dedica a brindarle su servicio de conductor en uno de los ministerio de salud, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su esposa no cuenta con ningún empleo únicamente es ama de casa.

Con lo poco del salario que él gana como conductor, no puede construir un cuarto que son sus sueños para su familia ya que se le va creciendo y amerita un mayor espacio para las condiciones de vida, es por eso que solicita financiamiento a Ceprodel y Kiva.

 Dicho crédito lo estará invirtiendo en la copra de Sementó, Arena, Ladrillo y pago de mano de obra, sus principales sueños es construir un dormitorio que le dará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

 El estima que a fines de año su vivienda estará mejor, pero para entonces necesita que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinden este tipo de crédito, de momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, y su honradez.

"Agradezco a Dios como primer instancia por haberme encontrado con Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos me sigan dando su mano amigable"
texts.en:
In the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a beautiful city with a variety of activities, Marlon José is known as a responsible and honest young man who is dedicated to his job.  Marlon José, born in this beautiful town, makes a living as a driver in one of the health departments in his town.  He has three children in his care.  His wife doesn't have a job, only as a housewife.

With the small salary he earns as a driver, he can't build a room, which is one of his dreams for his family because they're growing and need more space for their living conditions.  This is why he's requesting a loan from CEPRODEL and Kiva.  He'll be using this loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay for labor.

His main dream is to build a bedroom so his family will have better living conditions.

He estimates that his home will be better by the end of the year, but he needs CEPRODEL and Kiva to give him this type of loan.  At the moment he only has his good health, his capacity to work, and his honesty.  "In the first place I'm grateful to God for getting me together with CEPRODEL and Kiva, so they continue extending me a friendly hand."

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay for labor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is a resident of Malindi in Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of two school-going children. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for four years. In this cafe, she sells cooked potatoes, beverages and buns. Her main challenges are competition and a lack of funds to grow the business. She learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. She is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase chairs, tables, utensils and foodstuffs like potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family and help with the education of her children. She aspires to own another cafe in future.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, utensils and foodstuffs

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Priscillar owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for nine years. She began the business from the capital she received after selling one of her dairy cows.

Priscillar learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and fluctuating prices. Priscillar is applying for a loan of 73,100 Kenya shillings to buy foodstuff such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards. Priscillar hopes to own a wholesale shop and to pay for her children’s education from this loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for nine years. Kadii began the business from the capital she received after selling the produce from her farm.

Kadii learned about Milango from her friends and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is fluctuating prices. Kadii is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards. Kadii hopes to set up a wholesale shop and pay for her children’s education from this loan.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for six years. Umazi began the business from the capital she received after selling the produce from her farm.

Umazi learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high transportation costs. Umazi is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standards. Umazi hopes to own a wholesale shop and pay for her children’s education from this loan.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jose Raimundo

texts.es: José de 54 años de edad vive junto a su esposa de 41 años de edad y sus 3 hijos los cuales son su fuente de inspiración día a día. Es un hombre ejemplar, buen padre, esposo y amigo el cual se interesa por el bienestar de su familia y siempre le ha importado darlo todo por ellos, algunas de sus cualidades es que pacifico, trabajador, honesto y sincero. José se gana la vida honradamente vendiendo billetes de lotería, cada mañana emplea nuevos horizontes y sale a vender en conocidas zonas de la capital por su forma de ser tiene clientela la cual decide buscarlo y jugar lotería con billetes que el vende, ya que dicen que les da suerte. José desea comprar billetes de lotería a la propia empresa y no a revendedores para tener mayores ganancias y sea poco apoco su propio negocio pero por el momento no posee lo necesario para invertir en tal acción es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así poder cumplir su sueño cuenta con excelentes récords crediticios ya que es responsable en sus pagos. Confía en Dios que su vida poco a poco se solucionará y podrá cumplir sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
José is 54 years and lives together with his wife, 41 years old, and three children who are a source of inspiration to him every day. He is an exemplary man, a good father, husband, and friend. He is interested in the well being of his family, and it has always been important to him to give everything he can to them. He is peaceful, hardworking, honest, and sincere. 

José earns an honest living selling lottery tickets. He goes out every morning to sell with new goals, selling in areas that he knows in the capital. He has customers that decide to seek him out and play the lottery with the tickets that he sells since they say that he brings them luck. 

Jose wants to purchase lottery tickets from the business itself and not from the re-sellers in order to have better earnings and make it little by little his own business. For the moment, he does not have everything he needs to invest in such an action. This is way he joined up with INTEGRAL, to request a loan and be able to accomplish his dream. He has excellent credit records since he is responsible with his repayments. He trusts in God that his life little by little can be improved and he will be able to accomplish his dreams and goals.

loans.use: purchase lottery tickets from the business itself and not from resellers.

loans.name: Vida Concepción

texts.es:
Estimados señores de kiva, doña vida es una comerciante de ropa, su negocio lo empezó hace ocho años, fue motivada por su hermana a iniciar en esta actividad comercial, con apenas C$ 1,000.00 que le dio su esposo, y con las ventas fue motivada a desarrollar poco a poco hasta tener al día de hoy una tienda que ofrece una variedad de prendas de vestir.

Sin embargo para seguir ampliando su actividad comercial en esta temporada navideña, ella necesita el prestmo para comprar productos de mayor demanda en su punto de venta.

Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a vender comidas fritas y nacatamales.

Su estado civil es casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Introducing to you, Vida, who sells clothing, and who started her business eight years ago. She was motivated by her sister to begin this business, with about 1,000 córdobas that her husband gave her, and through the sales she was motivated to develop little by little until today she has a store that offers a variety of clothing.

However, in order to continue expanding her business for this holiday season, she needs this loan in order to buy merchandise most in demand at the point of sale.

She used to work selling fruit and tamales. She is married and has two school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, including pants, blouses and children's t-shirts to sell in her store

loans.name: Seydi Areli

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa y encantadora ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades comerciales, donde cuenta con lugares turísticos ubicada en el departamento de León, es donde habita la joven Seydi Arelis de 32 años de edad.

Seydi Areli se llama la Joven que en la actualidad se dedica a brindarle enseñanza a estudiante de educación primaria, necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel para la compra de madera y Zin, con esto  mejorara el techo de su vivienda ya que ella ha sido afectada por fuertes lluvias que le han ocasionado mucho daño.

Es madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana desea mejorar su vivienda y no seguir enfrentando esos problemas que le han ocasionado mucho daño a su familia, pero esto solo se le puede obtener a través de un crédito que le financie kiva y Ceprodel. 

Ella cuenta con la esperanza de obtener este tipo de financiamiento o a lo contrario seguirá viviendo duras penas con su familia.
texts.en:
The town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a precious and enchanting city dedicated to activities such as shopping, and where touristic places are found, is located in the territory of Leon. Here is where Seydi Arelis of 32 years of age resides.

Seydi Areli is the name of the young woman presently dedicated to bringing education to primary school-age students. She is in need of a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy wood and zinc.  With these, she will repair the roof of her house, which was badly damaged as a result of heavy rains.

She is a single mother in care of two children; wishes to use her small earnings to improve her house and end dealing with those problems that have hurt her family.  But this is only possible with a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel.

Seydi is hopeful she will get this type of financing, or else she and her family will continue to live with hardship.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Una de las tradiciones  de Nicaragua en Diciembre, sobre todo en el Sauce es que se celebra la gritería de la Virgen María, la cual es una alegre actividad donde se le canta a la virgen y se regalan golosinas y comida.

En este pueblo lleno de tradiciones y costumbres habita doña Andrea una señora de 55 años, madre soltera de cuatro hijos que le han costado únicamente a ella sin la ayuda del padre y que ha tratado de ayudarle en lo que puede bajo su pobreza y con su pequeño salario laborando como cocinera en un centro de enseñanza donde tiene más de 20 años de laborar.
Se siente muy orgullosa que gracias al sudor de su frente hoy tiene su propia casa la que ha ido mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos pero que necesita ampliarla más para que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida por lo que su familia es bien numerosa.
Por tal motivo solicita a KIVA la ayuda con un prestamo,para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. ya que tiene como meta terminar de construir un cuarto.
texts.en: A December tradition in Nicaragua, especially in Sauce, is the “Gritería de la Virgen María” [feast celebrated on December 7] that’s a joyful activity where people sing to the Virgin and exchange snacks and food.  Andrea, 55, lives in this town that’s rich in traditions and customs.  She’s a single mother of four children who she’s been raising alone with no help from their father.  Despite her poverty, she’s tried to help them in every way possible with her small salary earned working for twenty years as a cook at a school.  She feels very proud because thanks to the sweat of her brow she now owns her house that she’s been gradually improving with help from loans.  She needs to enlarge it so that her children can have better living conditions because her family is large.  Because of this she’s asking Kiva for help with a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay labor costs since her goal is to build a room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El Sauce es muy alegre en época de Navidad, es muy bonito ver las calles adornadas de árboles navideños como es el pino natural que crece en montañas sobre todo en estos meses.

Don Eleuterio es originario de este poblado, es un señor de 52 años padre de familia responsable que ha dedicado casi toda su vida a servirle a su gente, a salvar vidas de todas las edades ya que lucha y arriesga su vida día a día por tratar de llegar a tiempo al hospital.

Esta labor le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y mejorar en lo que puede su vivienda para brindarles a sus hijos un hogar digno donde vivir.

Hoy solicita la ayuda a KIVA a através de Ceprodel para que le otorguen un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc con el fin de terminar de ampliar un cuarto.
texts.en:
El Sauce is very cheerful during Christmas.  It’s very pretty to see the streets decorated with Christmas trees like the natural pine that grows in the mountains especially during these months.  

Eleuterio is from this town.  He’s a 52-year-old responsible father who has dedicated almost his entire life to serving others, saving lives of all ages because he strives and risks his life every day to try to reach the hospital.  

This job has made it possible for him to provide daily bread at home and to make home improvements wherever possible to provide his children with a proper place to live.  

He’s now asking Kiva through Ceprodel for a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc to finish enlarging a room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es:
Achuapa, es un pueblo ubicado a 110 km del departamento de León rodeado de montañas verdes y florecidas donde producen las riquísimas rosquillas y es una de las actividades principales que son a base de cuajada y dulce.

Doña Aura Luz se siente muy orgullosa de ser originaria de este poblado humilde porque en él habitan personas de escasos recursos que luchan día a día por salir adelante ejerciendo cualquier actividad que le genere ingresos para sobrevivir.


Ella ejerce la profesión de maestra desde hace  más de veinte años, diario se levanta desde muy temprano para caminar 20 km para llegar a la comarca Los Hornos donde está ubicada la escuela donde imparte clases a todos los niños de dicha comarca y para poder cumplir con su horario sale a las 5 am ya que no hay acceso en vehículos y solamente a pie se puede llegar.

Se siente muy satisfecha de tener su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando con el paso de los años  gracias a su esfuerzo y al sudor de su frente.

Solicito la ayuda a KIVA a través de Ceprodel para que le otorgue un crédito  para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra, con el fin de terminar de construir un cuarto.
texts.en:
Achuapa’s a town located 110 kilometers from León Department; it’s surrounded by green, flower covered mountains where the delicious ‘rosquillas’ [donut-shaped cookies] are made; it’s one of the main activities and they are made from cheese and sweets.  Aura Luz is very proud to be from this humble town because people of scarce resources live here who strive daily to get ahead doing whatever activity that generates income to survive.

She has worked as a teacher for more than twenty years.  She rises very early every morning to walk 20 kilometers to reach Los Hornos which is where the school is located where she teaches all the children from said district.  To meet her work schedule, she leaves at 5am because there is no vehicular access and it’s reached only by foot.

She’s asking KIVA through Ceprodel for a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and metal sheeting and to pay labor costs to finish building a room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, metal sheeting and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Pablino

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta bella ciudad ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua es originario el señor Pablino, su estado civil es acompañado el cual tiene dos hijos estudiante universitario.

Pablino es una persona de mucha visión empresarial y muy trabajador y con la responsabilidad de darle lo mejor a su familia, actualmente trabaja como seguridad de una Universidad pero aparte de eso el también se dedica al comercio y tiene dos negocio diferente uno que es una librería , este lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y hace unos poco días dio apertura a otro negocio que consiste en la venta de carne de pollo y huevos este  ultimo negocio lo tiene ubicado en otro barrio del mismo Estelí.

Con el préstamo que se le entrego lo destino para la compra de un freezer con capacidad de almacenar 500 libra de carne el cual va ser utilizado para su nuevo negocio.
Los negocio son atendido por Pablino en su tiempo libre y también por sus dos hijos, toda la familia se siente motiva y agradecida por Kiva y ceprodel por brindarle el apoyo a través del préstamo ya que ha sido posible mejorar la economía de su familia y a la misma vez generarle empleo.
texts.en:
Estelí, the city nicknamed "the Diamond of the Segovias," is located in the northern part of Nicaragua. Pablino is a native of this city. He lives with his partner, with whom he has two children that are studying in the university. Pablino is a responsible person with a big vision for his business. He works hard to be able to give his family the best.

Currently, Pablino works as a security guard at a university as well as in two other businesses. He operates a bookstore out of his home and he also recently opened a shop selling chicken meat as well as eggs from another location in the city. He attends to these businesses in his free time with the help of his children.

Pablino is requesting this loan to buy a freezer with the capacity to store 500 pounds of meat, which he will use in his newest business. His whole family is motivated and grateful for this loan and support from Kiva and Ceprodel. This will make it possible to improve the family's financial situation and, at the same time, create work for them.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing and shoes, a variety of blouses, skirts, trousers and new styles of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El deseo de superarse es uno de los sueños mas importantes de este joven que vive junto a su grupo familiar, él se dedica a la venta de tortillas y ya tiene tiempo con el negocio, eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias,  comercia desde su vivienda y de forma ambulante, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el servicio excelente; es un hombre luchador, dedicado a su labor todos los días se esfuerza por conseguir un futuro mejor con nuevos caminos y alejado de la violencia social de la que es victima la localidad en que reside, día a día se esmera al máximo pues esta feliz con su trabajo y no quiere decepcionar a su familia, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. El joven tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá llevar a su pequeño hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: One of this young man's greatest dreams is to make something of himself. He lives with his family and has been selling tortillas for some time. The business has given him valuable sales experience that helps him get better earnings. He sells out of his home and door-to-door. He is well known in his village and has a large customer base that prefers him because of the quality of his product,his low prices, and especially his excellent service. He is a hardworking, dedicated man who struggles every day to forge a better future with new possibilities that is far from the social violence he encounters in his village. He does his best every day because he is happy with his work and does not want to disappoint his family. In the last few weeks the demand for his product has increased, so he needs to make a new investment and is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy corn wholesale. The young man has good credit references and is very responsible. He says that he can pay back this loan, and he is confident it will bring his small household financial security.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Elmer Enrique

texts.es: Elmer de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Él es muy emprendedor y se dedica a la venta de mosquiteros, que son hechos a base de fibras de hilos y sirven para protegerse de los mosquitos; los comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, departamentos y ciudades, de esta manera él puede vender más con diferentes personas quienes en varios casos le hacen pedidos previos. Elmer desea contar con más cantidad de mosquiteros en distintos tamaños y colores con lo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de este modo obtener lo mencionado anteriormente.
texts.en: Elmer is 39 years old, and lives with his wife and two young children. He is very enterprising, and sells mosquito nets, which are made from fibers and he sells traveling through different neighborhoods, apartment buildings and cities. In this way, he can sell more to different people who in some cases do pre-orders. Elmer wants to have more nets in different sizes and colors so that he can increase his sales. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, so he can obtain what was previously mentioned.

loans.use: to buy mosquito nets en different sizes and colors

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEGNA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur dixième prêt. Les neuf précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce de condiments. 
DJENEBA qui est la présidente du groupe  est la la seule femme assise dans la photo. Elle fait l’achat vente de condiments et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 cartons de concentrée de tomate et 2 paniers de poivre et d’aubergine avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BADEGNA group consists of six women who are all married. On average,  they are 39 years old and have five children each.  They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons, and they reside in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through ties of community, friendship and commerce. In order to bolster their financial capacity and to do better at business, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their tenth loan with the institution; their nine previous loans were properly repaid.

This women's group essentially sells condiments.

Djeneba, the president of the group, is the only one sitting in the photo. She buys and sells condiments, and she is planning to use her loan to buy 10 boxes of tomato puree and two baskets of pepper and eggplants from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base which essentially consists of women. 

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 75,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in her business and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Wafa prefers that her photo not be on the Internet. Therefore, the photo is of her husband Mahmoud inside his printing house.

Wafa, 30 years old, is married and has one son and one daughter. For the past six years, Wafa's husband has operated a printing house, processing orders for publications, flyers, etc. for customers and institutions. The business has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. However, it needs more support from time to time to cover the costs.

Wafa is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing quantities of paper and doing the necessary maintenance on the printing machine, This will increase the project's efficiency and meet the clients' demands, which will increase the family's income positively and offer better living conditions to Wafa and her family.

loans.use: To buy paper for the printer and to pay for maintenance of the printing machine

loans.name: Alejandro Ramon

texts.es: Alejandro Ramón de  41 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos e 13, 8 anos de edad, es originario del Jicaral lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Alejandro se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, preocupado por el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería y librería desde hace 1 anos que tiene experiencia en el negocio.El cambio de actividad economica El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Y consiste en vender producto comestible de consumo diario para el hogar como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, azúcar, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Y productos de librería como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, fomi, pega, regla, folder, resma de papel. El negocio lo inicio hace varios anos con ayuda económica de sus padre. Y en la actualidad ha crecido poco  a poco y a mejorado su  clientela y ganancias. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pequeño negocio y seguir luchando día a día. La rutina diaria de  Alejandro es trabajar unas  12 horas diarias para brindarle mejor servicio a su clientela. Alejandro Ramón agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Alejandro Ramón, 41, is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 8.  He is a native of Jicaral, a place located in the western part of the country. Alejandro is known for being a very hardworking and responsible man who is concerned for the welfare and future of his children.  He has had a business for 1 years selling grocery items and stationery products, and so he is experienced in this line of work.  He has change his line of work from before.  His business is located in his house.  He sells basic food products such as: rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, juices, and soft drinks.  He also sells stationery items such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, sheets of foam craft paper, glue, rulers, folders, and reams of paper.  He started this business a number of years ago with the financial help of his father. Over time, he gradually grew the business, increasing his customer base and his earnings.  

Alejandro Ramón needs a loan to invest in working capital to stock his small store, so that he can continue to strive for success day by day.  Alejandro's daily routine is to work 12 hours a day to provide the best service to his customers.  Alejandro Ramón appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people who have few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a means to a decent life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, juices, and soft drinks, and also stationery items such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, sheets of foam craft paper, glue, rulers, folders, and reams of paper

loans.name: Petronila Del Socorro

texts.es: Petronila del Socorro de  53 anos de edad. De la localidad de la Paz Centro. Lugar que. Casada  con un hijo que estudia en la universidad. Ella tiene por actividad económica el servicio de taller de costura y venta. Tiene 20 anos de trabajar en dicha actividad. La cual surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para ayudar al esposo con los gastos del hogar. El negocio consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir como pantalones, uniformes, camisas, short, faldas, vestidos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en s casa de habitación. Con el financiamiento compra materia prima  para elaborar sus prendas como: telas, hilos, aceite de maquina, carrete, agujas. Petronila del socorro siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Y su mayor sueno y anhelo es poder ayudar a su hijo que se supere profesionalmente. Petronila del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Petronila del Socorro, 53, lives in the town of La Paz Centro.  She is married, has a son who is a university student, and works as a seamstress.  She has been in business for 20 years and started it to help her husband cover household expenses.  The clothing she makes includes pants, uniforms, shirts, shorts, skirts and dresses, and she works out of a room in her house.

She plans to use the loan to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, sewing machine oil, bobbins, and needles.  Petronila del Socorro has always been a very hard-working, responsible person with determination to improve her situation.  Her greatest desire is to help her son get professional training.  Petronila del Socorro is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with low incomes in poor counties like Nicaragua to be able to earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, sewing machine oil, bobbins and needles.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos tulio tiene  40  años de edad, esta soltero actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos y fumigantes. Este agricultor que por mucho tiempo ha tenido que velar por su madre, piensa dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar ingresos económicos para poder salir adelante, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar esta compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marco Tulio is 40 years old, and single.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure and pest killers.  This farmer has had to care for his mother for a long time and plans to provide maintenance to his coffee crops so that they won’t be damaged and production won’t be lost and he can earn income from his coffee-growing project to be able to continue moving forward.  He does not have the capital necessary to make this purchase because he’s of limited resources and does not have any way to get the money needed for this which is why he’s requested a loan.  This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has given him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella se dedica al oficio de corte y confección desde hace tres años, lo aprendió gracias a que asistió a una academia en 1992, situada en la ciudad que esta a media hora del lugar en donde vive. Antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa; pero ademas de dedicarse a la sastreria ella cuida una vaca, para obtener leche.  Ella camina unos treinta minutos hasta llegar al lugar en donde aborda el autobús que la conduce al lugar donde compra los insumos, viaja una vez al mes. Rosa confecciona los uniformes escolares de dos escuelas, son 129 unidades cada 6 meses para llegar a estos lugares, ella debe caminar treinta minutos para abordar el autobús y este tarda una hora quince minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca más. Para aprovechar el tiempo que le dedica a una y poderlo dedicar a dos. Con la inversión desea incrementar la producción de leche y asegurar la alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, is married and has 3 children.  She's had a dressmaking business for 3 years.  She learned this trade by attending classes at an academy in 1992, located in a city a half hour away from where she lives.  Prior to that, she worked mainly in the home; but in addition to working as a seamstress she also raises cows so obtain their milk.  She walks 30 minutes to arrive at the bus stop, where she takes a bus to the place where she buys her supplies.  She makes this trip once a month.  

Rosa makes school uniforms for 2 schools.  She delivers 129 uniforms every 6 months to these places.  To do this, she must walk 30 minutes to board a bus, and then it takes her an hour and 15 minute to arrive.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy another cow.  In the time it takes her to care for one cow, she could care for two.  With this investment, she wants to increase her milk production and ensure that there is food for her children.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Sexy L.a. Group

texts.en:
Verenice and Alfonso started Sexy L.A. in July of 2012 as a one-stop shop for women’s fashion apparel and accessories.  

Sexy L.A. is currently operating at a retail location in the Los Angeles Fashion District and is planning to operate an e-commerce store to target online buyers. Their dream is to provide fashionable clothing to people of all sizes. 

Vernice and Alfonso are seeking a loan of $5,000 to expand their inventory to more product lines and plus size clothing.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for more product lines and plus size clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire an additional employee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar terreno

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  est constitué de trois femmes mariées et une veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur dixième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de céréales et d’autres articles divers. 
Awa qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première de la gauche vers la droite, fait l’achat vente de condiments. 
Awa  compte acheter avec son  prêt, ½ tonne d’oignons, 5 paniers de choux et poivron et 1 sac de sel de cuisine avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group consists of three married women and a widow.  On average, these women are 49 years old and have six children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons, and they reside in the Dougounina neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through ties of community, friendship and commerce. In order to bolster their financial capacity and to do better at business, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their tenth loan with the institution; their previous loans have been properly repaid.

The women from this group sell condiments, grains and various other goods.

Awa, the president of the group, is the first woman from the left in the photo. She buys and sells condiments, and she is planning to use her loan to buy 500 kg of onions, five baskets of cabbage and peppers and one bag of kitchen salt from wholesalers in Sikasso. She sells at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a retail customer base which essentially consists of women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 85,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in her business and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Joen Patricia

texts.es: Joen  Patricia de 43 anos de edad, madres soltera con un hijo de 14 anos de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 15 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. La actividad consisten vender granos básicos, pollo, embutidos, salsas, jabones, detergente, gaseosas, huevos, jugos. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos y poco a poco  con los créditos que fundación le ha prestado le ha invertido al negocio. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diario y obtener mejores ingresos y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Joen Patricia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Joen Patricia, 43 years old, is a single mother of a 14-year-old son. She is from the Chinandega region and works in a grocery store that is located in her home. She has had this business for the past 15 years. Her job consists of selling basic grains, chicken, sausage, salsa, ham, detergent, soft drinks, eggs, and juice. The business was started due to her need to have a source of income to support her children. Little by little, she has been able to invest in her business with the help of the loans she has taken out.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital, stock her grocery store with everyday consumer products, earn more income, and provide her customers with better service. Joen Patricia is thankful that Kiva lenders provide support for people with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they may have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with products such as basic grains, chicken, sausage, salsa, ham, detergent, soft drinks, eggs, and juice.

loans.name: Mfungoni

texts.en: Mfungoni is a resident of Malindi in Coast province, Kenya. She is a mother of three grown children. She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for five years and which employs three other people. In this cafe, she sells cooked food and beverages. She learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts and competition. Mfungoni is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to renovate new premises where she will set up another cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family and help with the education of her grandchild, who lives with her.

loans.use: to renovate new premises where she will set up another cafe.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single business lady living in Changamwe, Kenya. She owns a butcher shop, which she has been operating for five years, as well as a grocery stall. Christine joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of meat and groceries. The extra income will form part of Christine’s future savings. Her current challenges are the high cost of stock and bad debts. She wants to own a larger business venture in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of meat and groceries.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is married and has two children. He is a retail shop owner living in Changamwe, Kenya. He has been operating the business for three years. The family also earns some income from his formal employment. He intends to improve his retail shop. His current challenges are the high cost of transport and bad debts.

Josphat joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar, flour, etc. The extra income will form part of Josphat’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. His desire is to set up a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother Osama appears in her Kiva profile photo, inside his store. Asmahan is an 18-year-old single woman. For the past two years, her brother has had a store selling spare parts for motorcycles, which is a means of transportation used frequently by people in the area where Asmahan and her family live. This venture has been considered a profitable one, since it has high demand from customers; but it needs more support to cover its costs. Asmahan is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her brother cover the cost of purchasing a collection of motorcycle spare parts. This will increase sales, improve the business, and increase the family's income, which will provide Asmahan and her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of motorcycle spare parts to resell

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a taxi owner living in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He has been operating the business for twelve years. His family also earns some income from a retail shop run by his wife. 

Boaz joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings (KES) to repaint the taxi car and to carry out minor repairs. His ambition is to register the business and provide the best taxi business in the area. 

The extra income will also form part of Boaz’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. The challenges currently are high cost of fuel, bad debts arising from the business, and at times a seasonal business climate. He desires to own more taxis in the future.

loans.use: To repaint the car and carry out minor repairs.

loans.name: Khamisi

texts.en:
Khamisi is a retail shop owner living in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He has been operating the business for three years. He began the business from the income he obtained from a green grocery stall.

Khamisi joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar and flour. 

The extra income will also form part of Khamisi’s future savings. Current challenges include the high cost of products and bad debts arising from the shop. He desires to set up a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: Jesús Antonio de 49 anos de edad, soltero sin hijos. Del departamento de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Jesús Antonio tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida rápida como: hot-dog, sanwis, hamburguesas, entre otros. Lo tiene ubicado de en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Desde hace 8 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio surgió como una iniciativa de trabajo para tener un ingresos para ayudar con los gasto de su casa. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en productos como pan. Salsa, lechugas, mortadela, queso, pepinillo, mostaza. Jesús Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua par tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio is 49 years old, single and does not have children. He is from Chinandega department, a place located in the western part of the country. Jesús Antonio's work is selling fast food such as hot dogs, sandwiches, hamburgers, and other items. 

His business is located in his home, and he is also a street vendor. He has been doing this work for eight years. His business came about as a work initiative so that he could help with the household expenses. 

He needs the loan to invest in products such as bread, salsa, lettuce, cold cuts, cheese, pickles and mustard. Jesús Antonio is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making fast food such as hot dogs, sandwiches and hamburgers, as well as to invest in working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shavers and other equipment, and to buy new compact discs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She operates a salon business, which she has been running for three years.

She learned about Milango through a friend and joined the group with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are a seasonal market and competition from other businesses of the same kind.

Janet is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy supplies such as hair chemicals, creams, and other items. The extra income arising from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard. She aspires to open other branches in future and to build a family residential house.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as hair chemicals and creams.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past year, Ahmad has been working in transporting goods to clients by driving a rickshaw. Ahmad wants to have independence in his work. By owning his own rickshaw, he would be able to work freely and improve his income.

Ahmad has an amount of money which is not enough to cover the price of purchasing a new rickshaw. Thus he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to complete the cost of purchasing the rickshaw. Taking this loan will enable Ahmad to have his own rickshaw and enable him to increase efforts to work extra hours and increase his income in order to ensure to himself better future.

Ahmad is photographed next to the rickshaw.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and have general maintenance done on her car.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a bicycle repair mechanic living in Malindi, Kenya. He is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. Gabriel has been operating his bicycle repair business for six years; in addition, he is a dairy farmer. The family also earns some income from a retail shop run by Gabriel's wife. 

Gabriel joined Milango at an invitation from his friends, and he is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to purchase additional spare parts, such as tires, chains, spokes, and dynamos, to use in bicycle repair. The extra income from the loan will contribute to Gabriel’s future savings and help him pay for his children’s school fees. Gabriel faces challenges like the high cost of spares and bad debts arising from the shop. He desires to set up a new bicycle sales shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy parts for bicycle repair.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Balinese artisan Nyoman specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as silver and natural gemstones to build up his stock.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I began learning to carve wood when I was in elementary school. My grandfather, an architect of traditional Balinese buildings and also a senior carver, was very supportive of me. Then my father introduced me to a leading silversmith in my village, and I began to learn from him. Now I make use of my carving ability when creating silver jewelry."

"Thank you for supporting me through this microloan; with this support I'll be able to have some capital to build up my stock. May life reward you accordingly. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Nyoman's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3703

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as silver and natural gemstones to build up his stock

loans.name: Dunia Arely

texts.es:
La señora Dunia tiene 26 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en  una comunidad urbana del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira. Ella tiene 2 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, churros y productos de limpieza.
Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a oficios domésticos, pero debido a la situación económica, decidió contribuir con la economía de su hogar. Con el fin de mantener surtido su negocio ha solicitado un préstamo  por la cantidad de 6000 Lempiras. Ella espera aumentar su clientela y generar mayores ingresos.
Su meta es mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dunia, 26, lives with her common-law husband and her 2 children in an urban community in the municipality of Gracias, in the department of Lempira.

For 2 years, she has had her own grocery store business where she sells consumer staples such as: rice, sugar, corn, beans, butter, condiments, beverages, chips and cleaning products.

Previously, she devoted herself to working in the home, but because of the economic situation she decided to contribute to the household finances.  With the goal of keeping her business well-stocked, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 Honduran lempiras.  She hopes to expand her customer base and generate more income. 

Dunia's goal is to improve her business and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, butter, condiments, beverages, chips and cleaning products

loans.name: Putu Gede

texts.en:
Putu Gede is a Balinese artisan who specializes in sterling silver jewelry with gemstone accents. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones to increase his stock.

Putu Gede has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is his story:

"I have been passionate about designing since childhood. I love to create pieces based on traditional styles combined with a modern look. I've come to realize the importance of having a skill, so I've made a point of offering free training in silversmith techniques. My hope is that by doing so, I will enable people in need to earn a modest living and support their families."

"I feel so lucky to meet people like you who care about my situation over here. Your support through this microloan is meaningful to me, as it is very useful: it means I can continue the work that I had to suspend for a long time because of limited financial resources. I will not misuse the trust that you have placed in me. I will try to give all that I can give. Please accept my love and respect."

Use the link below to view Putu Gede's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6981

loans.use: to purchase silver and natural gemstones.

loans.name: Henry Anthony

texts.en:
Henry Anthony is a Balinese artisan specializing in sterling silver and leather jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of sterling silver to continue production of his crafts.

Henry Anthony has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I studied in the United States and traveled to Japan and Europe. Jewelry is my passion, and my work let me gain experience in jewelry design and crafting. I moved to Bali in 2002 and established my own workshop. My collections are influenced by my Indonesian surroundings and my admiration of Japanese artistry. Designing jewelry for men has become part of my lifestyle.

I wish to thank you for assisting me with this microloan. It really helps my financial situation, and I'll be able to create new pieces in time for the holiday season. Thank you very much for your support."

Use the link below to view Henry Anthony's sterling silver and leather jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7116

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is a fish monger; in the picture above  she is smoking some of the fish she has bought from the market for resale. Efua has been selling smoked  fish for 3 years now. She is married with 4 dependants.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase fresh  fish to smoke and then sell. She will expand her business with the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and then sell

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is a master carver from Bali who specializes in traditional masks and sculptures. He would like to purchase wood to increase production and also to be able to employ others in his community.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was taught to carve by my older brother. The traditional forms and poses are beautiful and of fine workmanship, which inspired me to learn this style. My favorite themes to work on are characters in religious mythology because they offer a variety of ways for an artist to express creativity and style. What I wish now is to continue upholding the values of those who taught and inspired me, while being able to continue taking very good care of my family and my woodcarving group.

I really want to thank you all for contributing to this microloan. I'll be able to get my workshop started again after I had to close it due to a lack of financial resources. I want to say many thanks once more: without your support I would not be able to continue my wood carving work."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's masks and wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/381

loans.use: to purchase wood and to employ others in his community.

loans.name: Tului

texts.en:
Tului is 23 years old and single with no children. For three years, she has had a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yams, and other fruits and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. Tului needs a loan to buy farming supplies like a new weed sprayer, gramoxone, bush knives, and fertilizer.

Tului has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es: Claudia del Carmen de 42 anos de edad. Madre soltera de dos hijos de 15,13 anos de edad de la localidad de Chinandega. Lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Claudia tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, cosméticos, cajetas de  leche y coco, y repostería.  Tiene diez  anos de tener dicho negocio y lo realiza de forma ambulante. El negocio lo inicio con fondos propios la elaboración de cajetas y repostería lo aprendió de su familia, y la venta de  cosméticos y mercadería las  por las tardes con clientes fijos  y eventuales. Con el propósito de mejorar los ingreso de su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos que se formen profesionalmente para que tengan un futuro mejor. Claudia ha tenido créditos de fundación león  y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos como cajetas, reposteria, ropa de ninos, pantalones, blusas, faldas, vestidos,  y de dicha forma  mejorar sus ganancias. Claudia del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Claudia del Carmen is 42 years old.  She is the single mother of two children, who are fifteen and thirteen years old, and lives in the town of Chinandega.  Chinandega is located in the west of the country.  Claudia's business is selling general merchandise, cosmetics, caramels, coconuts and confections.  She has been in her business for ten years, and sells her products from the street.  She started the business with her own funds earned from making caramels and confections, which she learned from her family.  She sells cosmetics and merchandise in the afternoons to both regular and occasional customers.   Her goals for her work are improving her household income and helping her children to develop professionally so that they can have a better future.  Claudia has previously taken out loans from Fundación León and has shown herself to be responsible in repaying her loans in a timely manner.  She needs the loan to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with more products, like caramels, confections, children's clothing, blouses, skirts and dresses in order to improve her income.  Claudia del Carmen is grateful for the the help that the Kiva lenders offer to low-income people so they can earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest working capital in the purchase and re-sale of caramels, confections and merchandise, like pants, blouses, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Taupaolo

texts.en: Taupaolo is a 65-year-old married woman with 7 children.  She makes and sells pork buns, pancakes, and pies to earn a living.  She has 4 years of experience with this business.  Taupaolo needs a loan to buy ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, etc).  She plans to use her profits to support her business and to provide good financial support for her family.  Taupaolo has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata is a 56-year-old woman who is married with eight children. For three years, she has been running a business providing taxi services in her community. 

Ulata has requested a loan to purchase spare parts. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support for her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her taxi service such as fluid, filter oil, engine oil, and tires.

loans.name: Avalisa

texts.en:
Avalisa is a 47-year-old woman who is married with two children. For five years, she has run a business selling general produce and other goods in her community. 

Avalisa has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, lamb, and corned beef to sell in her shop. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and provide financial support for her family and children. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase produce and other foods for sale.

loans.name: Casto

texts.es: El Sr. Casto  tiene 25 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de cinco años,  el se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil,  el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Casto va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, que le hace mucha falta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  como es del área rural las distancias entre localidades son muy largas y el camino no está en buenas condiciones para que entren movilidades por lo que una  motocicleta es de muy buena utilidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Casto  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Casto, 25, has a small 5 year-old son.  He is a bricklayer who works in construction and remodels houses.  He lives in the town of El Torno.  This is his first loan from the institution.  

Casto will use this loan to buy a motorcycle, which is something he needs very much, because it will allow him to do his work in a more efficient manner.  He has contracts to complete, and this will allow him to get around more quickly to his work sites, because he has long distances that he has to travel.  He is in a rural area where the distances are long between the towns and the road is not in good condition for cars, and so a motorcycle would be very useful.  His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can continue to improve in his work.  

Casto is a very hardworking person who feels happy about the credit opportunity that he is getting, because this is the only activity he has that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Celina Estela

texts.es: Celina de 47 años de edad vive junto a su familia, su esposo y sus hijos mayores de edad y con esfuerzo aún están estudiando en el bachillerato, están muy contentos porque pronto se graduaran y podrán ayudarle a sus padres en la forma de llevar dinero a su hogar. Celina es muy amable y eso es una gran cualidad que posee gracias a ello, posee de clientes ya que ella con esfuerzo y dedicación se ha hecho acreedora de una bonita librería y es así como  ella se gana la vida honradamente.
