Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y a lo que hace para que en su hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día, aunque ella desea que su negocio crezca un poco más y es por eso que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar: Resmas de papel, Pegamento, Sacapuntas, Lapiceros, Lápiz u otros. Busca con esto hacer de su librería un lugar donde las personas encuentren de todo y poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida, confía en Dios que la ayuda será recibida y agradece a las personas que de buen corazón ayudan sin pedir nada a cambio
texts.en: Celina is 47 years old and lives with her family, her husband and their grown children.  Her children are working hard at obtaining their bachelor's degrees.  They are very happy because they will be graduating soon and will be able to help their parents to bring money into the home.  Celina is very friendly, which is a great quality of hers.  Thanks to her friendliness, she has a lot of customers.  Through hard work and dedication, she has made herself into the owner of a beautiful paper goods store, which is how she makes an honest living.  Celina is very dedicated to her work, because of which her family is never lacking in their basic needs.  Even so, she wants her business to grow a little more.  So she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase reams of paper, glue, pencil sharpeners, pens, pencils and other items.  With these purchases, her store will become a place where people can find anything they may need and little by little, it will improve her quality of life.  Celina has faith in God that she will receive the help she is asking for, and she is grateful to the people who, out of a good heart, offer help without asking for anything in return.

loans.use: to purchase reams of paper, glue, pencil sharpeners, pens, pencils and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres de Unidas con el total de 10 Mujeres, todas tienen familias realizan respectivos trabajos. Todas se comprometen a juntar ya su ahorro para poder avanzar de ciclo. La señora Gloria es una de la integrantes del comité que trabaja en su pequeño copetín que actualmente ya es más grande y ya es una despensa, está contenta por la oportunidad que le dio la fundación ya que ninguna entidad no se la dio.
Vuelve a solicitar un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, comestibles, y demás insumos para poder seguir dadno buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: The Mujeres de Unidas ("Women United") group consists of 10 women, all of whom do their jobs while having families. All of them promise to work together to save for the future. Gloria is one of the group members, and she works at a little snack stand, which has grown and is now a convenience store. She is happy for the opportunity to work with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, since no other organization gave her one. She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks, vegetables, and other groceries to keep giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, vegetables and other groceries.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama produces kenkey for sale (kenkey is an African dish made out of maize).  She has been in this business for some time now. She is a widow and  lives together with her 3 children at Nkrotrodo near Elmina.  She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of more kenkey. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the production of more kenkey

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man. For the past year, he has had a beauty & cosmetics store which has a good reputation among clients and many loyal customers. It is Mohammad’s  only source of income, and while it is considered a profitable venture for him, it still needs more support to cover its costs. Mohammad is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase cosmetics and perfume that customers often request and buy. This will increase sales and improve his income, which will ensure that his business remains successful. Mohammad is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en: Sarona is 32 years old and married with 4 children.  She has a small business making and selling hand fans, fine-mats, necklaces and other items in her community.  To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials and resources.  In the future, Sarona hopes to improve her business.  She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pandanus leaves, a paint brush, paints and coconut shelves.

loans.name: Eric Jack

texts.es:
Eric es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene un pequeño hijo de cuatro años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, gracias a su esfuerzo Eric pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con su pequeño y en algunas ocasiones comen juntos un riquísimo Ceviche, el cual es el plato favorito de ambos. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Eric trabaja como repartidor en una empresa de mensajería de su ciudad, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, Eric se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y traba bien a los demás.
Eric se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña moto de segunda mano, de esta manera Eric podrá transportarse desde las lejanías de su hogar hasta su centro de trabajo y podrá hacer las reparticiones de mensajes de manera más rápida, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus metas y su sueño de tener su casa propia donde podrá brindarle mayor bienestar y seguridad a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Eric is a man of 26. He is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He has a young son who is 4 years old, whom he loves and who is his principal reason for living. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to raising his little one. Thanks to his efforts, Eric was able to study for a career as a systems engineer. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his little son, and sometimes they enjoy eating a delicious ceviche together, which is the favorite dish of both.

On his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Eric works every day as a deliveryman for a messaging business in his city. He can work about 8 hours a day. Eric feels comfortable doing his work and believes that it is going well for him because he is very responsible and works well with others.

Eric is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks the help offered he will be able to make the purchase of a small secondhand motorcycle. In this way Eric will be able to transport himself from the remoteness of his home to his work center, and he will be able to make deliveries of messages more rapidly. Thus he will continue working and striving to reach his goals and his dream of having his own house, where he will be able to offer well-being and security to his little son.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Carmen es uno más situado en la ciudad de Curuguaty con  14 mujeres las cuales son vecinas, amigas y parientes, y todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante y velar por sus sueños.
Salvadora es parte de este grupo, y trabaja en la venta de ropas, cuenta que es muy difícil la competencia hoy en día, pero le gusta lo que hace y lucha por su familia, y no se cansa, solicita de este crédito para poder tener más prendas y de esa forma dar mejor variedad a sus clientes.
Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben, pues les es de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The Virgen del Carmen group is from the city of Curugaty and consists of 14 women who are neighbors, friends and parents. All of them work and help each other to make headway and to reach their dreams. Salavadora is one of the members, and she works selling clothing. She says it is very difficult with all the competition, but she likes what she does and tirelessly fights for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more clothing items and in this way offer more variety to her customers. The group members are grateful for the opportunity they are getting and think it will be very helpful.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
En la  Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el fin de formar un grupo, el cual lleva por nombre Mujeres Solidarias, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de responsabilidad, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo.
Felia, miembro del grupo vende verduras y cuenta que este ha sido su sustento y el de su familia hace un tiempo. Es una persona muy trabajadora y se cree muy capaz de seguir ayudando a los suyos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, zanahorias, cebollas y demás.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women got together to form the communal bank which carries the name "Mujeres Solidarias."  They are committed to stay united as a group, and to work within a framework of responsibility.  They are currently in their 4th loan cycle.

Felia is a member of the group who sells vegetables.  She says that this business has been the means of support for her and her family for some time.  She is a very hardworking person who believes that she is very capable of continuing to help her family.

Felia is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables, such as: tomatoes, peppers, carrots, onions and other vegetables.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, carrots, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 22-year-old single man. He is employed and earns a small salary which is not enough to cover his needs.  For the past two years, he has also had an aluminum workshop; he purchases aluminum and works it into multiple forms of windows frames and cabinets and other items upon the request of clients. It has been a profitable venture, but it needs more support to cover its costs. Rami is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase more aluminum to continue his work. This will enable him to meet his customers’ demands, which will increase his sales and boost his income. Rami is photographed inside his workshop.

loans.use: To buy aluminum for his workshop

loans.name: Soi

texts.en: Soi is a 25-year-old single woman with no children.  She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living.  She has 3 years of experience with this business.  Soi needs a loan to buy mixtures, sugar, foam cups, etc.  She plans to use her profits to improve her small business and to help her family’s financial situation.  Soi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy mixtures, sugar, and foam cups for her ice-cake business.

loans.name: Mujeres Anfitrionas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Anfitrionas nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde cada una de las miembros tiene su trabajo independiente, pero se ayudan también y así salen adelante.
La Sra. Carmen, una de las miembros, es costurera, cuenta que está creciendo gracias al apoyo que está recibiendo de sus compañeras y de  fundación. Su meta es poder tener un gran taller de confecciones y también poder ayudar a las demás personas con fuentes de trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en: The Mujeres Anfitrionas group started by bringing together a collection of working women from the same place. This group is from the city of San Lorenzo, where each one of the women works independently but also help each other make headway. Carmen, one of the members, is a seamstress. She says her business is growing thanks to the help she is receiving from her fellow members and Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya. Her goal is to be able to have a big sewing workshop and to be able to help her fellow members with their jobs. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons and other sewing supplies so she can keep working and growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Asoiva

texts.en:
Asoiva is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Asoiva needs a loan to buy a new weed sprayer, 5L of Gramoxone, bush knives, fertilizer, and other equipment.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Asoiva will use the profits from her sales to extent and expand her plantation and also help to support her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, gramoxone, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
This is Lily, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Victor, a seaman, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lily operates a retail business. She buys slippers and sandals at wholesale prices and sells them individually with a little profit. She also sell bags and notebooks. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices. She also operates a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lily hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Faamaini

texts.en:
Faamaini is 63 years old and is married with 10 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Faamaini needs a loan to buy a new weed sprayer, 5L Gramoxone, bush knives, fertilizer, and other equipment she needs.

Faamaina has been a member of SPBD since 2009. She will use the profits from her sales to extent and expand her plantation and also help to support her family and kids."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bush knives, weed killer, gloves, shovels, and other equipment

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used buy of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. She also has a variety store and the loan will be of big help for her businesses. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lily hopes to grow her business and become successful through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kaisalina

texts.en: Kaisalina is a 37-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes (similar to a snow-cone) in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Kaisalina needs a loan to buy flavor mixtures, sugar, foam cups, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her small business and to help her family's financial situation. Kaisalina has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flavor mixtures, sugar, foam cups, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
MUJERES LUCHADORAS DE SAN ISIDRO” esta en el tercer ciclo con 23 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, donde cada una tiene su actividad productiva, pero también trabajan juntas y así se ayudan.
Una de las historias es la de la Sra. Cintia, quien se dedica a la venta de helados. Ella tiene su pequeña heladería, con la cual surte a la gente de su barrio con helados muy ricos y de buena calidad. Cuenta que ya tiene buena clientela y que de a poco está creciendo y mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de helados de variados sabores, con los cuales quiere poder dar una buena variedad a sus clientes y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Luchadoras de San Isidro", with 23 women from the city of Asunción, is on its third cycle. Each of them has her own productive activity, but they also work together so they help each other.

One of the stories is that of Cintia, who is dedicated to sell ice cream. She has her small ice cream shop, with which she supplies the people of her neighborhood with delicious and good quality ice creams. She is requesting this loan to buy ice creams of different flavors. She expects to provide good variety to her customers and continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy ice-creams to sale.

loans.name: 15 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité 15 de Mayo cuenta con 11 integrantes donde todas tienen actividades productivas. Formaron el comité con el compromiso de trabajar en  conjunto, para poder ayudar a sus familias e ir progresando en el trabajo de cada una de ellas.
Etelvina, la presidenta del grupo cuenta, que al principio fue difícil convencer a sus amigas, pero que después accedieron y gracias al trabajo de todas están mucho mejor. Ella tiene una despensa y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para abastecer su local, como ser fideos, arroz, leche, manteca, huevos y demás, ya que siempre quiere tener de todo, para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en: The May 15th group consists of 11 members who all have productive activities. They came together to form the group and help each other's family and make progress with all of their businesses. Etelvina, the group president, found it difficult to convince her friends at first, but once they joined, and thanks to everyone's hard work, they are doing much better. Etelvina has a convenience store and is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to stock her store, like noodles, rice, milk, lard, eggs and other items, since she always wants to have everything to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, milk, lard, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья уже несколько раз использовала средства, полученные от КИВА, для развития и расширения своего бизнеса. Наталья планомерно развивает две точки продаж, торгуя на одной из них самостоятельно и поставив реализатора на другой. Доходы у нее – стабильные. Недавно смогла приобрести для себя тренажер, чтобы внимательнее следить за здоровьем. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту от КИВА Наталья смогла выкупить коллекцию спортивного ассортимента весна-лето (костюмы, шорты, футболки) по хорошим ценам и успешно ее реализовала. 
В этот раз Наталья обратилась за кредитом в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы завезти новый товар на вторую точку, увеличив сбыт. Она планирует закупить теплые спортивные костюмы и куртки под реализацию в зимний сезон, когда начинается сезон активного лыжного отдыха. Наталья не боится трудностей, однако, немного переживает по поводу роста продаж одежды через интернет, из-за которого молодежь стала меньше бывать на рынке и, значит, наблюдается определенный спад в торговле.
texts.en: Nataliya has received loans from Kiva a few times in the past in order to develop and expand her business. She is systematically developing two sales outlets, working at one herself and having hired a salesperson for the second one. She earns a steady income from them, and recently has been able to buy exercise equipment so she can take care of her health. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she was able to buy a collection of spring-summer sportswear (tracksuits, shorts, and t-shirts) at a good price, and successfully sold it. This time, Nataliya is seeking a loan of 8,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy new goods for her second outlet to increase sales. She plans to buy warm tracksuits and jackets to sell for the winter when the ski season kicks into high gear. Nataliya is not afraid of difficulties; however, she is somewhat worried about the increase of internet shopping for clothing, as young people are not coming to shop at the market as often, which is leading to a drop-off in business.

loans.use: to purchase new goods for her second sales outlet

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela  is a 52-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience in this business. Rasela needs a loan to buy popcorn, butter, popcorn machine and salt. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and provide the best quality product. Rasela has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, butter, popcorn machine and salt.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina is 52 years old and married with four children. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Monina buys and sells ready-to-wear dresses and other clothes. She had been in this business for 34 years and earns 18,920 PHP a month. Monina joined GDMPC in 2007. Monina is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en: Nuufou  is a 59-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells Samoan cocoa in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience in this business. Nuufou needs a loan to re-supply her business with more cocoa beans, a cocoa grinder and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to maintain her small business and provide support to her family. Nuufou has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans, a cocoa grinder and foam cups.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Villa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El comité es un grupo muy activo, y a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes supieron salir adelante , el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 7º .
La Sra. Maria es la tesorera del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta, ella tiene ventas de Bijouterie de todas clases y quiere seguir trabajando ya que desea que su negocio crezca y poner otras cosas mas con lo que ya tiene  con su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar pulseras, cadenas, anillos y demás bijou, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y así seguir ganándose la vida honradamente.
texts.en: This group is very active and despite some inconveniences the members have been able to overcome and make headway and are now in their seventh loan cycle. Maria is the group treasurer and takes her position seriously because she is very strict. She sells all kinds of jewelry and wants to keep working because she wants her business to grow and add more to it with hard work. She is requesting the loan to purchase bracelets, chains, rings and other jewelry to offer her customers so she can keep making an honorable living.

loans.use: to purchase bracelets, chains, rings and other items.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Priscilla been raising pigs/hogs for five years and she earns an income of 6,500 PHP per month. Priscilla became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Uila

texts.en: Uila is 38 years old and married with four children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Uila needs a loan to buy more taro and small banana plants to grow and tools. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Uila will use the profits from her sales to help the business extension.

loans.use: to buy taro and banana plants, fertilizer, shovels and gloves.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис в тепличных условиях для последующей реализации на рынках своего региона. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже 20 лет. У Татьяны две теплицы, плюс одна дополнительная для рассады. 
Татьяна планирует вложить кредит в размере 17 000 гривен в подготовку теплиц к высадке помидор, а также в закупку семян, пленки, навоза и удобрений для нового сезона. В этом году Татьяна планирует натянуть на теплицах вторую пленку, чтобы немного раньше высаживать овощи и, следовательно, начинать раньше ими торговать.
texts.en: Tatyana grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes in greenhouses to sell at the markets in the region where she lives. She has been doing this business for 20 years. She has 2 greenhouses, plus another one for seedlings. She wants to take a loan of 17,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to prepare the greenhouses for planting tomatoes and to buy seed, plastic covering, manure and other fertilizers for the new season. This year, Tatyana plans to put a second layer of plastic film on her greenhouses so she can plant her vegetables a little earlier, thereby allowing her to start selling them earlier.

loans.use: to prepare greenhouses and to buy seeds, plastic greenhouse covering, and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina "Mujeres Unidas”, tiene 13 integrantes, donde cada una tiene su respectiva ocupación. Gracias al apoyo de todas, ya están en su segundo ciclo y quieren llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La  Sra  Paola, quien es la presidenta, se dedica a la venta de frazadas, comenta que en época de calor igual vende sus productos, ya que muchas personas en el calor utilizan acondicionador de aire y frazadas, pero también hace otros trabajos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frazadas, para surtirse y seguir ganadose la vida de esta forma. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, la cual no va a desaprovechar.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas (United Women) has 13 members, where each one has her respective occupation. Thanks to everyone’s support, they are already in their second loan cycle, and they want to reach the top level of the program. 

Paola, who is the president, works selling blankets. She says that during the warm season she still sells her products, since many people in the heat use an air conditioner and blankets, but she also does other work. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of blankets, in order to stock up and continue earning a living in this way. She is grateful for the help that she receives, which she is not going to waste.

loans.use: to purchase blankets to sell.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир живет в Мелитополе. У него есть собственный автобус, на котором он перевозит предпринимателей в Одессу за товаром. Этим Владимир зарабатывает на жизнь уже 15 лет. 
Владимиру необходима сумма в 5000 гривен для того, чтобы подготовить свое транспортное средство к зимнему сезону: поменять резину на зимнюю, сделать необходимый ремонт и прочее.
texts.en: Vladimir lives in Melitopol. He has his own bus that he uses to drive businesspeople to Odessa to buy goods. He has earned his living this way for the last 15 years. Vladimir is now seeking a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to prepare his vehicle for winter by changing to winter tires, doing necessary repairs, and so on.

loans.use: to prepare his vehicle for winter

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four children. Teresita has raised pigs for fattening and for meat purposes for almost 11 years. She usually gets a monthly income of 6,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase feeding supplies. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Teresita hopes to raise pigs on a large scale and gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга живет в Мелитополе. Она занимается торговлей мужской одеждой, рубашками, джинсовой одеждой, а также женской и подростковой одеждой на местном привокзальном рынке. В этой сфере Ольга работает вот уже 17 лет. Магазин, в котором она торгует, она арендует. 
Ольга обратилась к КИВА за суммой в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную мужскую, женскую и подростковую одежду под реализацию.
texts.en: Olga lives in Melitopol. She sells menswear, including shirts and denim clothes, as well as womenswear and clothing for teenagers at the local market near the train station. She has been working in this field for 17 years. She rents the shop where she works. Olga has come to Kiva for a loan of 21,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to buy seasonal clothing for men, women, and teenagers for her to re-sell.

loans.use: to buy seasonal menswear, womenswear, and clothing for teenagers to sell

loans.name: Glicelle Anne

texts.en:
This is Glicellle, 27, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mario, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Glicelle operates an accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from a wholesaler and sell them by the piece or pack for a profit. Her products range from beaded jewelry like necklaces and other similar products to bags, lotion and perfume. Customers are attracted to buy from Glicelle's business due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Glicelle hopes to have her own house and dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Soifua

texts.en: Soifua is 51 years old and married. She has 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taros and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Soifua needs a loan to buy new weed spray, fertilizers and etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Soifua will use the profits from her sales to increase the quality of her plantation and also the financial support for her family.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizers, shovels, gloves.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan to buy beverages, groceries, toiletries and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she dreams that her children will be successful. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages, grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Apotala

texts.en:
Apotala is 49 years old and married. She has 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taros and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Apotala needs a loan to buy a new weed sprayer, 5L Gramoxone, bush knives, fertilizer and other equipment she requires. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Apotala will use the profits from her sales to extent and expand her plantation and also help to support her family and her kids.

loans.use: to purchase bush knives, weed killer, fertilizer, gloves and shovels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Sergio Sr.

texts.en: Sergio Sr. is 43 years old, and is a married entrepreneur of Militar, Tukuran with 7 children. He is earning from his fishing business. It has been running for almost 4 years now and he earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, he has borrowed 5,600 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit, which he just joined recently, to obtain fishing equipment such as nets. Before long, he is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain fishing equipment such as nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Зайнура   женщина в возрасте 35 лет.  Замужем, имеет 3 детей.  Она работает учительницей в средней школе  в своем районе  около 15 лет.  Муж её  водитель .   Занимается перевозкой  строительных материалов  по заказу. Дети Зайнуры  пока учатся в школе.   Дом   где они живут  нуждается в капитальном  ремонте, условия очень плохие. Зайнура   с  мужем  столько лет  работая накопили  денег  для ремонта но все же этих денег  не хватает и она обратилась в Арванд чтобы получить кредит и закончить свой ремонт.  На полученный кредит Зайнура планирует купить строительные материалы. Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Zaynura is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has been working as a teacher in a junior high school in her area for around 15 years. Her husband is a driver who transports construction material. Her children are all in school. The house where she lives with her family is in need of major renovations as the conditions are very bad. Zaynura and her husband have been working for many years to save up money for repairs, but have not yet managed to set aside enough. For this reason, Zaynura has come to Arvand for a loan so she can finish the renovations. She plans to use the money to buy building materials. She is grateful in advance to Arvand for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 32, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and she manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually support her own needs and the needs of her mother.

Evangeline buys and sells charcoal. She buys big quantities of charcoal and then sells it by the bucket or sack. She also sells ice and coconut. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of charcoal and additional capital for her electronic load. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline hopes to help her mother financially and dreams to be with her longer. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Gleceria would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help Gleceria to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gleceria dreams to expand her store and hopes to give a good education to her daughter through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is from Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old. Norma is married and has three children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business venture making and selling food like barbeque and many other types. Norma been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Norma joined GDMPC. Norma is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and to pay her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merlita dreams to expand her store and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
This is Catalina. She previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase garden inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan that she will be utilizing to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the garden. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Catalina hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
This is Adoracion. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that she will be utilizing to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the farm. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Adoracion hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life by the grace of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Saveun

texts.en:
Saveun (pictured here) and her husband are rice, potato and sugar cane farmers. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and three daughters.

Saveun had asked and used her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides (http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/357878).
 
She hopes to continue her farming business. This is why she has applied for another loan in the amount of $300.

loans.use: to continue her farming business by purchasing fertilizer and oil gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en: Genevie, is married and has 3 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Militar, Tukuran. To earn a living, Genevie operates a family business venture: she sells fish while her husband harvests fish. She has been in this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP from this business. She has requested a loan of 7,300 PHP to buy fishing materials. Genevie joined GDMPC this year. In the future, Genevie wants to build a house and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maju Lancar 1 Group

texts.en:
Musalifah, 39, is blessed with two children: Rizky, 17 years old, now in Senior High School, and Riko, 15 years old, now in Junior High School. Her first business sold fried snacks with capital of 500,000 IDR. Now she has expanded and changed her business to sell "nasi uduk," one of traditional foods of Indonesia which consists of rice cooked with coconut milk along with a spread of egg and noodles.

Musalifah loves her business. Her dream is to send her children to a college until they attain master's degrees. Musalifah wears the black T-shirt in this photo.

loans.use: to add capital and to buy the material coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Rosaline. She is married and has 4 children aged 5, 9, 14 and 21. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to help in running the business. In 2008, Rosaline established her food, drinks and catering services business. The business was started to help her retired husband in running the affairs of the home. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are lectures' students and visitors to the area. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Rosaline requires this loan in order to buy drinks and beverages. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and maximize profit. In the future, Rosaline plans to establish another canteen at the other side of the town. She thanks ARD for the support, and also thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and beverages

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en: Tuinanau is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Tuinanau needs a loan to purchase more seeds and farming tools such as fertilisers, shovels and a bush knife to expand her vegetable garden. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tuinanau will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farming tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed in making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy turntables, amplifier, headphones, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Franco

texts.es: Pablo Franco cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia. Él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora portones, balcones, entre otros ya tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro, que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y además obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar de trabajo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia comercial y está en su residencia, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Pablo es un hombre emprendedor dispuesto a salir adelante y siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar y mantener el éxito, en esta temporada quiere aumentar la producción pero no posee de suficiente capital para la compra de materia prima por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro por mayor. Pablo Franco es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, se siente satisfecho por la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo Franco, 59, lives with his common-law wife and children in their own house.  He has a metal structure workshop where he makes gates, balcony rails, etc. and has several years' experience in the sector, giving him the capacity to make quality products and earn a good profit.  He works from his home which is in a busy commercial area.  He has many customers because people know of his good quality and low prices, but especially his excellent service.

Pablo is an enterprising man who is determined to get ahead, always looking for new opportunities to be successful.  Currently, he wants to increase production but does not have sufficient capital to buy raw material.  Therefore, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy wrought iron wholesale.  Pablo Franco is very responsible and has a good credit record.  He is satisfied with this support and sure he can pay back the loan, while giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wrought iron wholesale.

loans.name: Emilio Ernesto

texts.es: Emilio Ernesto de treinta años de edad vive junto a sus padres y su hermano, el es empleado, un excelente trabajador honesto, responsable y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante pues quiere sobresalir y alcanzar el éxito, como todo buen hombre lo mas importante en su vida es su familia y el trabajo con el que sostiene su hogar, desde hace algún tiempo su vivienda ha tenido varios deterioros necesita cambio de techo y algunas otras reparaciones necesarias para la seguridad y la comodidad de todos los miembros de su familia, para este hombre es indispensable empezar cuanto antes la mejora de la vivienda pero tiene una dificultad y es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la inversión por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sementó, tejas, polines, ladrillos, etc. Emilio Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago, se siente satisfecho con la ayuda y asegura que saldara la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene confianza que ofrecerá en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emilio Ernesto, 30, lives with his parents and brother.  He is employed and is an excellent, honest, responsible worker with a lot of determination to get ahead and be successful.  Like all good people, the most important thing to him is his family and the job he has to support the household.  For some time now, his house has been in a bit of disrepair and needs a new roof as well as other minor repairs for the family's safety and comfort.  He wants to start the home improvements but does not have sufficient capital.  Therefore, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cement, tiles, poles, bricks, etc.

Emilio Ernesto has a good credit record and is grateful for this support.  He is confident he can pay back the loan on time, while being able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cement, tiles, poles and bricks.

loans.name: Marleni Carmen

texts.es:
Marleni es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos; lamentablemente Marleni no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Papita con Maní para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Marleni trabaja como cocinera en un pequeño hotel de su ciudad, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, Marleni se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marleni se siente agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la inscripción, matricula y materiales de estudio, ya que uno de sus hijos iniciará sus estudios universitarios y Marleni desea poder ayudarlo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Marleni, 36, lives in the city of Nazca with her two children, who she adores and who are the main motivation in her life.   She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who dedicates all her effort to providing for her family.  She is both mother and father to her children and, unfortunately, was unable to get professional training, although she would have liked to.  In her free time she enjoys watching educational programmes on TV and sometimes she cooks a delicious Papita con Maní (potato and peanut stew) to share with family.

Marleni is a dedicated employee who works as a cook in a small hotel in the city.  She works eight hours a day and enjoys what she does.  She believes she is successful because of her delicious cooking and the kind service she provides to customers.

Marleni is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them she is able to cover education registration fees and materials costs for one of her children who is a university student.  She wants to continue working hard to reach her goal of helping her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To cover educational registration fees and materials costs.

loans.name: Unidas De Saguazu Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Unidas de Saguazu,  ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener a su grupo unido y de solucionar cualquier problema que pueda surgir. Una de estas mujeres es Lidia, quien vende Carbón.
Ella comenta que la venta ha crecido mucho, ya que las personas hoy en día prefieren cocinar a carbón ya que es mas barato y eso la ayuda mucho,  a tener mas venta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón en cantidad, ya que tiene siempre mucha venta y no quiere quedarse sin su principal producto.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Unidas de Saguazu".  The members have taken on the commitment to keep the group together and resolve any problem that may arise.  One of the members is Lidia, who sells charcoal for a living.

She says sales have increased dramatically because nowadays people prefer to cook with charcoal which is a much cheaper fuel.

She is requesting a loan to buy larger volumes of charcoal due to the large demand, as she does not want to run out of her main product.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella es dueña de una despensa, se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 5 años, no tiene esposo pero si dos hijos por quienes ella siempre ha luchado con todas sus fuerzas.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena moral de pago. Nos cuenta que se ve sola con sus dos hijos, y por eso tiene que esforzarse el doble y darles todo y que tengan así una vida digna.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is in the city of Pilar. She is the owner of a store. She has done this activity ofr more than 5 years. She doesn't have a husband but she does have two children for whom she has always fought with all of her strength. 

She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman with a good payment ethic. She tells us that she is alone with her children, so she has to have double the effort and give them everything they need so they can have a dignified life. 

She is asking for this loan so she can stock her business with beverages, food, vegetables, fruit, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food, vegetables, fruit and more.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora Rocio de 27 años, casada con el Sr Eladio, tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad que va a la escuela en el primer grado.
Ella es ama de casa, vive con su familia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa y con ellos también vive su suegra,  su esposo trabaja como vendedor en una casa de venta de autopartes, y es el sostén principal de la casa.
Ella cuenta que quiso ayudar a su marido y se puso a estudiar para hacer servicios de manicura y pedicuro, colocación de uñas, etc.  Y de esa forma esta ayudando a su marido, ya que realiza servicios a domicilio y están saliendo adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmaltes en variedad de colores, pestañas y uñas postizas, cremas exfoliantes para pies, cremas de masajes, etc.
texts.en:
Rocio is 27 years old. She is married to Eladio. They have a 7 year old son who is in first grade.  She is a housewife who lives with her family in the city of Villa Elisa and her mother in law lives with them as well. Her husband works in a car parts business and he is the family's main breadwinner.

She says that she wanted to help her husband so she began to study how to do manicures and pedicures, how to apply fake nails, etc. In this way, she is helping her husband, because she offers the service in people's homes and they are getting ahead. 

She is asking for this loan to buy nail polish is a variety of colors, fake eyelashes and nails, exfoliant creams for feet, massage creams, etc.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes in a variety of colors, fake eylashes and  nails, exfoliant creams for feet, massage creams, etc.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
La Sra. Pablina tiene 48años. Ella es casada con dos hijos en edad escolar. Tiene su despensa ubicada en su propio domicilio hace más de 4 años. Además de esto ella tiene varias maquinas de costura, donde trabaja en confección de prendas de vestir sobre medidas y también algunos uniformes  para una escuela de la zona.
Necesita de este crédito para comprar unos rollos de telas para remeras y busos para las clases de educación física que se desarrollan en la institución escolar. Ella anhela ver que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y poderles servir de ejemplo a estos, pues toda su vida fue una persona emprendedora, legado que desea dejar muy profundo en sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablina is 48 years old. She is married with two schoolaged children. She has had a store located in her own house  for 4 years. In additino to that she also has various sewing machines where she makes clothes to order and also some uniforms for a local school.

She needs this loan to buy rolls of fabric for t-shirts and sweatshirts for physical education classes that are offered in the school. She longs to see her children finish their studies and to be an example for them. All of her life she has been an enterprising person, and this is a legacy she deeply wants to leave her children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita is from Sto Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 58 years old. Romanita is a widow and has one child. To make a living, Romanita has been running a general store for eight years and earns 5,800 PHP a month for these activities. 

Romanita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used  to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. In 2008, Romanita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo (brand of malted milk), shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Anoanoai

texts.en: Anoanoai is a 53-year-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Anoanoai needs a loan to buy ingredients to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to fulfill her family's needs. Anoanoai has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and baking soda for her pancake-making business.

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang was successful in maintaining her pigs and her husband supports her business because it can help to improve the family income. She was also successful in renovating the barn.

Now she needs a new loan to purchase piglets and she also has a plan to buy a saw. Because the loan is not enough to purchase it all, her husband has given her money to support the business. She hopes to get healthy piglets so she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: To buy piglets and a saw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Sari Karya group is receiving another loan from MUK of  22,500,000 IDR. There are 15 members in the group and each member will get 1,500,000 IDR. The loans are used to support the pig businesses.

Ni Ketut used the loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is IDR 450,000 per piglet. The remainder of the loan was used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Ketut is feeding her pigs with traditional feeds made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves.

Ni Ketut is pursuing this effort in order to support the family financially and particularly so she can participate in the cost of educating her two children.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Faatolu

texts.en:
Faatolu is 50 years old and married with 11 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Faatolu needs a loan to buy equipments and fertilizer for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

Faatolu will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees and to purchase a new land for her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a  wheel barrow, a bush knife and spears.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has two children. Elsa's source of income comes from her general store which she has run for five years and from which she earns 2,500 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines.  She is 36 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community. Jocelyn has engaged in her business for 3 years and earns 9,000 PHP a month. Jocelyn has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sale. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms. Shahida is a 29-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, are in the business of making artificial jewellery and have been for many years. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s husband.  The business has great potential for growth and Shahida is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. They have four children, none of them are going to school. The couple wishes to send them to school by trying to increase their earnings to afford educational expenses of their children. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Shahida requested for a loan of 10,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase their net income and intends to use that to provide good and quality education for their children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 32-year-old married woman with one child. 

She would like to start growing taro plants and bananas to earn a living. Jacinta has requested a loan to buy seeds, tools and bushknifes to start her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years.Jacinta will spend her profits to purchase a new land to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, fertilizers, shovels and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 33 years old. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran. Erlina is married and has four children. Erlina is a farmer and she operates a gardening business venture to earn a living. She's been doing this business for eight years. Every month she earn PHP 5,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This year, Erlina became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Erlina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Paulina De Jesus

texts.es: Paulina de 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su familia. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace algunos años. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener activo su negocio y es así como  quiere mantenerlo ya que es uno de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. El negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación el cual ha ubicado de manera estratégica de tal forma que parezca atractivo para los clientes y se sientan motivados a solicitar sus productos. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable ya que siempre que se pone una meta trabaja muy duro para lograrla, tomando en cuanta que siempre tiene presente que desea brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Paulina ha estado pensando en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio ya que últimamente ha notado un leve aumento en la demanda de sus productos. Todo esto la ha motivado a acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así poder invertir en productos de tienda como: frijoles, arroz, macarrones, pan, leche, café, azúcar,  etc. de tal forma que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y pueda logar un amento en sus ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paulina, 49, lives in her own house with her family.  She has made a living with her store for several years.  With a lot of effort and dedication she has managed to keep her business active because it's one of her main sources of income.  The business is located strategically in her home so it's attractive to the customers, who are motivated to request her products.

She's known as a hardworking and responsible woman because she always has a goal for herself.  She works very hard to achieve this, always keeping in mind that she wants to give her family the best.

Paulina has been thinking about how to make her business grow because lately she has noticed a slight increase in demand for her products.  All this has motivated her to approach Integral for a loan to invest in store products such as beans, rice, pasta, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.  This way she can offer her customers better service and increase her profits, thus allowing her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, pasta, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana es una joven alegre y trabajadora quien vive con su pequeña hija de seis años de edad, y su madre. Para salir adelante y tener una vida estable junto a su hija, Ana trabaja comercializando carne de res en el mercado de su lugar de vivienda, negocio con el que puede sostener su hogar y ayudarle a su madre con todos los gastos. Ana solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de carne de la mejor calidad y así de esta manera poder agradas a todos sus clientes, quienes son su prioridad ya que gracias a ellos su negocio se mantiene firme, con lo que Ana aumenta sus ventas y tendrá una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana is a happy and hardworking young woman who lives with her young daughter, age 6, and her mother.  Ana works selling beef in the market in her home so she can get ahead and have a stable life with her daughter.  With the business she can support her household and help her mother with all the expenses.

Ana's asking Integral for a loan so she can buy the best quality of beef wholesale.  This will please her customers, who are her priority because thanks to them business is steady.  With this Ana's sales will increase and she'll have a better life.

loans.use: to buy beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Cherry Ly

texts.en:
This is Cherry, age 36, who is a resident of Caloocan in the Philippines. She is married to Von, a driver, and she is a mother to her child. She and her husband manage their household as they operate a business. She is working hard to provide an income to her family to pay for their everyday expenses.

Cherry has a franchise store called Buko Twister. She sells buko shakes (coconut smoothies), which are famous in the Philippines because of the tropical climate. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns PHP 600 daily.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and to pay for the maintenance of her equipment. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Cherry hopes to give her child a high-quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and pay for the maintenance of her equipment for her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Rosalina has been buying and selling fruits, particularly bananas, for two years now. She earns an income of 15,400 PHP per month. 

Rosalina became a member of GDMPC in 2010. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more bananas and other fruits to sell. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
This is Erminda, 30, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Erminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erminda dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is married with 2 children. He is 38 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rolly operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years and every month he earns 7,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 24,800 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. This year, Rolly joined GDMPC. Rolly hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DANAYA  est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, d’habits et de céréales.
MARIAM qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de condiments et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de cube Maggi et 400Kg d’oignons avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group is made up of six women, all married, who are on average 41 years old and have five children.  They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the Dialanikoro district of the city of Bougouni.
They know each other as neighbors, friends, and through business.  In order to strengthen their buying power and to better conduct their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their fourth loan.  The previous loans have been fully repaid.  This group of women is in the business of selling condiments, clothing, and cereals. 
MARIAM, the leader of the group, is the first woman from the right.  She buys and sells condiments and with her loan she plans to buy two cases of Maggi cubes and 400 kg of onions from the wholesalers in Sikasso.  She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Soonalote

texts.en: For the last ffour years Soonalote, a 28-year-old married mother of two, has been operating a business selling twists, buns, donuts, sugars, powder, toothpaste, soups, etc. in her community. A member of SPBD since 2010, she has requested this loan to buy a variety of materials needed in her enterprise. Soonalote plans to use her profits to extend her business and to save for a better family future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour. twists, salt, ice blocks, and lolies for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alma dreams that her children will finish studying with a good and quality education. She hopes that she and her family will continue to have good health and a strong spiritual life. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week, for the teachings and sharing of the word of God continue to enlighten and uplift her spirit.
