* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: With her previous loan, Alice was able to buy a gas cooker. This has made her services faster and more efficient. It has attracted more clients to her business, thereby increasing her sales. It's against this background that she now wants to buy warmers, which will further increase efficiency. With them, she will be able to prepare large amounts of food and still keep it warm regardless what time the customers come, especially since they do not all come to eat at the same time. With another loan she will buy more warmers which will support her outside catering dream. She is excited that the loans are helping her to improve her business, much as she still constrained by her limited funds.

loans.use: to buy food warmers.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion, a 56-year-old resident of Payatas, Philippines and a mother to her children, is married to Felomino, a driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Consolacion operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Erminda dreams of having a good life and hopes her grandchildren will have a good-quality education through all of her hard work on the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI  est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier DOUGOUNINA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits et légumes avec BINTOU qui est la présidente du groupe  et la seule assise dans la photo. BINTOU et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400Kg de pomme de terre avec les grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is made up of five women, all married, who are on average 34 years old and have six children.  They live together in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the Dougounina district of the city of Bougouni.
They know each other as neighbors, friends, and through business.  To strengthen their buying power and to better conduct their businesses, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth loan.  The previous loans have been fully repaid.  This group of women is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables with BINTOU, who is the leader of the group and the only one seated in the photo.  With her loan, Bintou plans to buy 400 kg of potatoes from the wholesalers in Sikasso.  She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women. 
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA which will be invested in her business and also go to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, age 44, who is a resident of Caloocan in the Philippines. She is married to Victor and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a tailoring business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn an income to pay for her everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home-decorating items. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gina hopes her business will grow and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Purita is a farmer. She has been managing a gardening business of planting vegetables for six years. Every month she earns 2,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Purita has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Purita hopes her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Vine

texts.en: Vine is 49 years old and married with 5 children.She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana crops that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Vine needs a loan to help pay for her children's education and tools for her business, such as  fertilizers, bush knives, and a wheel barrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Vine will use the profits from her sales to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy tools for her farm and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат молодая женщина, живет за городом в сельской местности со  своей семьей.   Её муж  сейчас находится в России на заработках, так как в селе нет хорошего постоянного дохода.   Он там занимается строительными работами и по возможности   каждый месяц присылает   домой деньги .  Вместе с Инобат жувут сын и дочь, которые помогают ей в хозяйстве.  Основным семейным доходом является откармливание скота. Накопив деньги которые прислал муж в течении года Инобат  недавно  купила еще несколько голов скота и старается развивать этот бизнес.  Таким образом она содержит семью.   Сейчас старший сын Инобат уже взрослый и она собирается его женить и она обратилась в нашу организацию за помощью и надеется получить у нас кредит на проведение свадьбы сына.  Она не в состоянии собрать большую сумму на это мероприятие и решилась взять кредит, а её муж обязуется помочь в погашении кредита.   Она заранее благодарит нас за   понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Inobat is a young woman who lives a lives in a small town in the countryside with her family.  Her husband is working in Russia, as there is no steady source of income in her village; he is a builder there and sends monthly money home as he is able.  Inobat lives with her son and daughter, who help her around the farm.  The main family income is from raising livestock.  By saving the money her husband has sent over the course of a year, Inobat bought a few head of livestock not long ago and she is trying to increase her business.  In this way, she can support her family.  Inobat's elder son is already grown up and she is preparing for his wedding, so she turned to our organization for help.  She would like to receive a loan to use for her son's wedding.  She is not capable of spending a large amount of money on this event and she has decided to take out a loan, which her husband has agreed to help repay.  She thanks us in advance for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding accessories

loans.name: Puspa Kencana Group

texts.en:
Puspa Kencana group is getting their fourth loan from MUK. With eight members, the total loan is 12M IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair pens.

Ni Putu, as the head of the group, is using her loan to buy three piglets (superior species). The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from Rp.400,000 - Rp.500,000. These pigs will be maintained for 5 months for fattening. Ni Putu expects that during the loan period, the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream of fixing her house.

loans.use: To buy three super quality piglets.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children.She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Sina has requested a loan to buy seeds, tools and fertilizer to make an improvement in her business. She has been a member of SPBD for four years. 

Sina will spend her profits to pay for her children's school fees and to purchase more land to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, a wheelbarrow, and chemicals.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 45 years old  and comes from Kobuleti, West Georgia. She lives with her husband and two children (15 and 16 years old). Her husband sells agricultural products locally with his own car. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 calves and 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. 

Lamara owns a plot of land where potatoes and 100 nut trees are grown. She sells harvested produce locally as well as in the nearby villages. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Lamara requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, Lamara will expand her dairy business. It will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Lamara awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   TIESSIRI  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits et de condiments.
 MAMA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente d’habits et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 mètres de tissus pour sa tricoterie et des bobines de files  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses articles tricotés au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of 4 woman, who are all married and who, on average, are 30 years old and have 5 children. They live in nuclear families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. They know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is now their fourth loan. All of their previous loans have been repaid.

This group of women deals in clothes and in condiments. Mama, who is the president of the group, is the first woman in the photo on the right. She buys and sells clothes. With this loan, she hopes to buy 150 meters of fabric for her knitwear and spools of thread from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She sells her knitted goods at a market and from home, accepting cash and credit from customers who are mostly women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which she will use to invest in the [group's] businesses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA  est constitué de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de tubercules et des habits.
SALIMATA qui est la présidente du groupe  et la  seule femme assise dans la photo, fait l’achat vente de condiments. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, divers  colis de condiments avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The DANAYA  group is made up of four women, all of them married, who are on average 42 years old and have, on average, four children. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the Médine district of the town of Bougouni. They met through being neighbors, friends and business associates. To strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third loan. The preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

This group of women sell condiments, tubers and clothing. SALIMATA who is the president of the group and the only woman who is seated in the photo sells condiments. She intends to use her portion of the loan to buy various packets of condiments from the wholesalers of Bougouni. She makes her sales in the market and at home, retail and for cash or credit, to a clientele essentially made up of women. She expects to make a monthly average profit of 90,000 F CFA which will be invested in her business and used to reimburse the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 48 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace varios años. La tienda está ubicada en su hogar de residencia la cual ha sabido adecuar de tal forma que llame la atención de los clientes.  Sus vecinos dan buenas referencias tanto de su trabajo como de su persona. Es muy conocida y preferida ya que es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora la cual ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos quienes ven como ella se ha superado día a día. Su mayor deseo es seguir recibiendo los ingresos de su negocio que hasta el momento le han ayudado a cubrir gran parte de las necesidades de su hogar. Es por esta razón que se decidió en hacer este préstamo con el fin de incrementar su inventario ya que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios  para realizar dicha inversión por sus medios. El crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL es para comprar variedad de productos de tienda tales como: maíz, arroz, aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, bebidas, macarrones, sopas, etc. ya que desea cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado que le permita incrementar sus ingresos de tal forma que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel, who is 48, lives in her own house with her two children.  She has now been running her shop for a number of years.  The shop is situated in her home, which she has adapted to attract customers' attention.  Her neighbours are complimentary both about her work and about Isabel as a person.  She is well known and popular as she is a very friendly and hardworking woman, and she has gained the trust of her neighbours, who can see how she has bettered herself day by day.  

Her dearest wish is to continue making an income from her business which, to date, has helped her to cover most of her household  needs.  She decided to apply for this loan to enable her to increase her stock, as she does not have the means to make such an investment on her own.  The loan which she is seeking from INTEGRAL will be used to buy a range of goods for the shop, such as: corn, rice, oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, drinks, macaroni, soups, etc.  She wants to meet growing market demand, as this will allow her to increase her income and provide better opportunities in life for her family.

loans.use: to buy goods such as: corn, rice, oil, rice, sugar, beans, sweets, drinks, macaroni, soups, etc.

loans.name: Sipaepae

texts.en:
Sipaepae is a 75-year-old married woman with 8 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu,and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

Sipaepae has requested a loan to improve her business by buying new equipment. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Sipaepae hopes to earn more money to provide her family with everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, seeds, and bush knives.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
This is Liberty, 47, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a lineman, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband manages their household as they operate the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Liberty operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need  as customer demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who need her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or office documentation; as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liberty dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes to have their own house through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of a 15-year-old son from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in her fishing business for more than 15 years now. 

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat. Through this investment, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Esmeralda dreams of making her business a success and saving money for future use.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells banana chips and taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business.

Racheal needs a loan to improve her home condition. She plans to use her profits to provide her children's education. Racheal has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy roofing, cement, nails, paint, and timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for viands and snacks.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has four children.

For the past ten years, Mwanasha has had a small business selling cereals. She sells at the market in a strategic position that has attracted many regular clients. She feels responsible since she can help her spouse to cover the basic expenses.

Mwanasha is requesting a KES 20,000 loan from Yehu to help her cover the cost of purchasing cereals like beans, maize, peas, and others. She is sure to achieve a good income out of this investment.

loans.use: to purchase cereals like beans, maize, peas, and others.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
This is Rafael, 36, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is married to Rosiel, an operations manager, and he is a father to their children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rafael operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Rafael dreams to have a good life and hopes his child will have a good and quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rose Bernadette

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 32 ans, mère de 2 enfants dont les ages sont de 4 et 2 ans. Elle gère un petit bar dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle y vend des boissons hygièniques. Elle a acquis au cours de ces années une expèrience ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable mais son stock de marchandises ne permet plus de la satisfaire. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons et renforcer son stock de marchandises (boissons hygiéniques). Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera injecter dans l'ouverture d'un nouveau site et pour les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Rose is a woman of 32, mother of two children aged four and two. For seven years, she has been running a little bar in town where she sells healthful drinks. She has acquired enough experience over these years to be able to attract a sizable clientele but her stock of merchandise does not permit her to satisfy her customers. She is thus asking for this loan to be able to buy more cases of drinks and grow her stock of merchandise (healthful drinks). The profit that this  loan will bring in will be in part invested in her business with the rest going into opening a new venue and for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Halema

texts.en:
Halema is a 51-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to three sons, 26, 22 and 20 years old. One of them is employed and another is a university student. 

Halema's husband is a worker who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Halema wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to cover the costs, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows and painting. Taking this loan will create to Halema and her family suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 56 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have eight children between 8 and 24 years old. All of them are enrolled in schools. 

He has spent 38 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizers and paying labor cost during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 29 years old, from the small village of Lanchkhuti district. He lives with his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. 

Guram is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of land where maize and nut trees are grown. Guram and his mother work hard to insure a good harvest.

Besides, the family has a dairy business. They have six milk cows and 30 calves. They sell dairy products locally in an open market.  

Guram requested a loan to rent agricultural land. After purchasing another plot of land, he will implement his future plans. He plans to purchase additional calves and expand his dairy business. It will increase their income and he will be able to improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land and purchase additional calves.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 29-year-old man. He is newly married and works with the rest of his family in agriculture, specifically in olive trees. This has been a profitable project, but there is not enough to cover all the costs.

Currently, Alaa is preparing to live in his new house with his wife. But due to a money shortage, some of the work has been stopped for awhile. So he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to continue the house by installing new windows and doors. 

Taking this loan will offer Alaa and his wife suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To install windows and doors.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 44 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have five children between 5 and 20 years old. They are all enrolled in schools. 

He has been a maize farmer for the past 15 years. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizers and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Aza

texts.en:
Aza is from the Zestaponi district of West Georgia. She is 43 years old, a widow and lives with her children (21 and 23 years old). Her elder son works as an artisan locally and gets a monthly income. 

Aza leads the family agricultural business. In particular, she runs an animal husbandry business and has two cows, an ox and a pig. She milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese products that she sells at the local open market. In addition, the family owns a vineyard and agricultural land where they grow different kinds of vegetables.

The family is the beneficiary of state financial assistance as a family living below the poverty line. 

With the requested loan, Aza plans to start up a trade in secondhand clothes. She will purchase the clothes from wholesalers and sell them in the village among the villagers. According to her estimations, she will have many customers as secondhand clothes will be popular because of affordable prices. With the increased income, this family will improve their living conditions by purchasing better food and household items. A part of the loan will be used for covering the expenses related to death anniversary of Aza’s husband. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 33 years old, married, and has children. She is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of  500 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Edna is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands the business. 

Edna hopes to give her children a good education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week,  where she draws strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Nenana

texts.en: Nenana sells cosmetics, panties, ladies wear, children's dresses, and underwear. She also sells body cream and hair creams.  She is a single parent and has 2 children.  They live together at Nkrotrodo near Elmiina.  As a single parent, she uses her income for the general upkeep of her children.  Nenana will use her loan to purchase more goods to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, panties, ladies wear, children's dresses and underwear to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viands

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. She cooks banku (a dish made from corn dough) and serves it with okra soup and fish under a tree at Nkrotrodo near Elmina.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  She supports her partner to educate, feed and clothe her children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients to cook her banku for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients to cook her banku for sale.

loans.name: Twizerimana Group

texts.fr:
Léa fait partie du groupe Twizerimana et habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de  50 ans. Elle a 3 enfants âgés de 11 à 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de haricot,  de banane,  et de maïs depuis  3 ans.

Elle est à son dixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, et de bananes  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Avec le gain du commerce, elle parvient à  payer les frais scolaires des enfants, assurer les  soins de santé et nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Léa is part of the group Twizerimana and lives in Gitega. She is a widow of 50 years old with three children aged 11 to 17 years. She has been a merchant selling beans, bananas, and corn for the past three years. She is currently on her tenth loan with Turame. Léa plans to use this loan from Kiva to increase her capital. She will do this by purchasing a large quantity of rice, beans, and bananas and reselling them, thus earning more income.

With the gains she makes as a merchant, Léa will be able to pay for her children's school fees. She will also be able to feed her family and ensure that they have proper health care.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of rice, beans, and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Santos Virginia

texts.es: Santos vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como taxista y así mismo vive junto a su hija de 14 años de edad que se dedica a estudiar. Santos posee una venta de jugos naturales, tamales, y otros platillos típicos, el negocio se encuentra sobre una calle principal donde transita gran cantidad de personas, incrementando sus ventas por la mañana cuando las personas se dirigen a su trabajo o al estudiar. Santos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de frutas para realizar más jugos y así mismo materia prima para realizar más platillos típicos, los cuales producen ventas muy estables, principal razón para invertir en sus ventas y así poder contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her husband, a taxi driver, and her 14-year-old daughter, a student.  Santos has a business selling natural juices, tamales, and other traditional dishes.  The business is on a main street with a lot of passersby, which increases her sales in the morning when people are going to work or school.

Santos is asking Integral for a loan to buy fruit to make more juices and ingredients for traditional dishes, which produce very stable sales.

Her main reason for investing in her business is to be able to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make fruit drinks

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino es un hombre viudo de 56 años, a pesar de la irreparable pérdida de su esposa fue el soporte único de sus 6 hijos, por quienes hoy se siente muy orgulloso de haberles dado todo el apoyo necesario. Con el esfuerzo que lo caracteriza ha logrado construir una casa de material noble para sus hijos y ya mayores lo acompañan y forman una gran familia unida. Desde muy joven llegó a esta parte de la selva con el objetivo de superarse y buscar una mejor vida, al no conseguir terrenos para cultivo se vio en la necesidad de involucrarse en el rubro del transporte rural, es así que lleva 15 años desempeñándose como tal y ha sido el mejor de los sustentos para sus hijos. No obstante, necesita disponer de tiempo en cualquier momento haciendo de su trabajo uno de los más abnegados y a la vez reconfortantes. Sin embargo en temporadas de lluvias, haces que las vías de acceso se complican más de lo normal.
Aunando el esfuerzo de muchos años tiene el deseo de ampliar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes cuyas encargadas sérían sus hijas, dentro del cual incluye la compra de víveres de primera necesidad así como la de conservas entre otros.
Desea en lo posterior realizar el cambio de su unidad por una de mayor capacidad para así continuar laborando como transportista. Viene siendo parte de MFP con 14 créditos, pues siempre ha mostrado la responsabilidad en el cumplimiento de sus pagos. Lo motiva pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que siempre fue una buena manera de trabajo con microcréditos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda, como conservas y cereales.
texts.en:
Paulino is a 56 year old widower.  Because of the irreparable loss of his wife he was the only support for his six children.  He is now very proud of having given them all of the support they needed.  With the effort that he is known for, he managed to build a house of strong materials for his children.  They are now adults, they join him, and they form a great united family.

Ever since he was very young he came to this part of the jungle in order to improve himself and to look for a better life.  When he did not get land for crops, he felt it was necessary to get involved in the rural transportation business.  That is how he has been working for 15 years.  It has been the best way to support his children.  However, he needs to be ready to work at any time, making his work self-sacrificing yet rewarding.  Even so, during the rainy season the access to routes is more complicated than normal. 

With his collective efforts of many years, he wishes to expand his small grocery store.  His daughters will be in charge of it.  They store will sell basic needs items like preserves, among others.

Afterwards he will exchange his vehicle for one with a greater capacity in order to continue working as a driver.

He has been part of MFP for 14 loans.  He has always demonstrated responsibility in making his payments.  It motivates him to belong to his communal bank because it was always a good way of working with microloans.

He will use the 1,000 soles to buy merchandise to implement his store with things like preserves and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy preserves, basic grains, and canned goods.

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Fulvia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 52 años, es soltera, con 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, trabajan independiente. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de menudencia en el Mercado tiene muy buena clientela formada, buen ingreso. Ella es una persona que desde siempre ha trabajado y que desea seguir haciéndolo, pese a su edad.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de menudencias y así seguir dando un buen productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fulvia, 52, is from the city of Santaní.  She's single and has four children, all adults who work independently.  She makes a living buying and selling offal in the market.  She has very good stable customers and a good income.  She's someone who has always worked and who wants to continue doing so, in spite of her age.

She's requesting this loan to buy offal so she can continue giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy offal to sell

loans.name: Josiane Carole

texts.fr:
Josiane est une femme mariée de 39 ans, mère de 6 ans dont l'âge du premier est 20 ans et le dernier est 7 ans.
Elle detient une petite unité dans un coin de la ville où elle vend des produits de premières necessités depuis 7 ans. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, elle s'est fait une clientèle grandissante qu'elle n'arrive plus à satisfaire. Afin de palier à ce problème, elle voudrait ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour augmenter le stock de ses marchandises (riz, farine, beurre, chocolaté, lait en poudre etc...)et de ce fait ces ventes et marges bénéficiaires. Ces bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité en vue d'en faire une grande boutique, mais également de subvenir aux besoins (éducation) de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josiane is a 39-year-old married woman, and mother of six children between the ages of seven and twenty years old. She has her small shop in a corner of the city. There, she has been selling basic necessities for the past seven years. Thanks to her energetic personality and her expertise in this field, Josiane has amassed an ever-growing clientele whose demands she can no longer satisfy.

To overcome this problem, she is seeking a loan from ACEP Cameroun so that she can increase the stock of goods she has on hand. She plans to purchase rice, flour, butter, chocolate, and powdered milk among other things. With this increase in her supplies, Josiane will be able to increase her sales as well as her income. This loan will enable her to expand her business into a larger shop, as well as to meet the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (including rice, flour, butter, chocolate, and powdered milk), for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.fr: Bernard est jeune homme de 32 ans, célibataire avec un enfant âgé de 3 ans. Il a ouvert un petit salon de coiffure pour hommes qu'il gère depuis 10 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et son rapport avec son voisinage, il a pu acquerir une très forte clientèle dont des hommes d'affaires. Afin de palier à ce problème,, il voudrait ce crédit afin d'augmenter son stock de produits cosmétiques pour augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour agrandissement et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant (éducation et nutrition) et de sa famille.
texts.en: Bernard is a 32-year old man, single and the father of a 3-year old child. He has a men’s hair salon that he has been managing for 10 years. Thanks to his friendly welcome and his good community relations, he has been able to build up a strong customer base that includes some businessmen. To respond [to demand], he would like to receive this loan in order to increase his stock of cosmetic products so that to increase his sales volume and consequently, his profits. He will reinvest a part of the revenues in further growth of his business, and the rest will allow him to provide for the needs of his child (education and food) and his family.

loans.use: to buy materials and merchandise [cosmetic products for his hair salon].

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Рахим   клиент Арванда  с 2010года,он занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке.  Ему помогают его жена и сын. По началу он  не хотел брать кредит,так как не был уверен в своих доходах. Но по совету своих коллег по работе  рискнул получить кредит и превзошел свои ожидания. Дела Рахима  пошли на лад и он получил хорошую прибыль.  Постепенно расширил свою торговую точку и ассортимент товара.  Теперь он не боится получать кредиты в более больших размерах. Накануне зимнего периода он собирается закупить партию зимних мужских вещей на продажу.  Он рад что сотрудничает с Арванд и надеется до конца работать с этой организацией .
texts.en:
Rahimjon is Arvand's client since 2010. He makes a living by selling men's clothing on a market. His wife and son help Rahimjon in running the business. Initially, Rahimjon didn't want to take out a loan, because he wasn't confident in his revenues. But, thanks to advice from his friends, he took a risk, asked for a loan and exceeded all of his expectations. He was able to expand his shop and product range with the new profits. Now, he ins't afraid to ask for bigger loans. 
On the brink of the winter season, he wants to purchase some men's winter clothing items for resale. He's happy to work with Arvand and wants to continue the cooperation in the future.

loans.use: to buy winter men's clothing.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells sanitary pads in Nkrotrodo near Elmina, which she has done for three years. Maame is a single parent with one child, so she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay her child’s school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase more sanitary pads to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sanitary pads for resale.

loans.name: Forgive

texts.en: Forgive sells cooking utensils and saucepans in Nkrontrodo near Elmina. She is married and has six children. Forgive has been selling for 10 years now.  She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. She will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her cooking utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama, 28, is a married woman. She has three children and lives with them in the suburban area of Likoni in the municipality of Mombasa. She makes and repairs clothing in her tailor shop. Her workshop is at the market and she makes items to order. She has a good clientele. The loan she is requesting from Yehu is her third and is for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy fabric and thread to make more clothes. This loan will help her fill pending customer orders and have more of her products in stock. Her goal is to continue growing the business because it has always been the source of family income.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread to make garments.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, She previously obtained a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 8,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of helping her children in giving a good education to her grandchildren. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married, with five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. 

Rosalyn has run a general store for five years to earn a living, and she earns PHP 7,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Rosalyn has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Rosalyn's plan is to save her returns in order to support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Pelagiaa

texts.en:
This is Pelagiaa. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy larger quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pelagiaa hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock needed for her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando's main source of income comes from his banana production business. He is 40 years old, married with five kids. He is from Carangan, Ozamis City and been five years in business, earning an amount of 5,200 PHP a month. In 2008, Rolando joined GDMPC. Rolando is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte is 47 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children aged between seven and thirteen years old; all of them attend schools. He has spent 25 years in farming. He would like to get the Kiva loan for buying fertilizers and paying labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits for buying a tractor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Parmen

texts.en:
Parmen is 44 years old and from the small village of Samtredia district. He has a large family: his wife, two children (20 and 21 years old) and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family runs agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. 

Parmen owns a plot of land, where 200 nut trees are grown. He sells about 300 to 400 kg of nuts seasonally. Besides, he has a minibus and trades with fruits.  Parmen is very hard working and has a rich experience in his business. 

Parmen requested a loan to buy tires and an accumulator for his minibus.  The existing tires and accumulator are out of commission and need repair. 

After repairing his minibus, Parmen will be able to trade more fruits and thus increase his income. With increased income, he will expand his business and improve the living conditions for the family. Parmen awaits your support

loans.use: to purchase tires and an accumulator for the minibus

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tessie hopes that her business will expand and grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 27 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been working as a farmer for the past 9 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production. She plans to use the profits for buying a tractor for better farming in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and cover labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Las Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
Las dinámicas es el grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, son 11 mujeres que están empezando a trabajar juntas. Están en su primer ciclo, y cuentan que están muy contentas por la oportunidad de progreso y prometen mantener unido el grupo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ely, quien vende prendas y con esto quiere poder ayudar a su familia y tener los medios que necesitan para que no les falte nada.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder comprar prendas y así empezar con una buena cantidad de ellas.
texts.en: “Las Dinámicas” (The Dynamic Ones) is a group of 11 women from Encarnación who are starting to work together.  They are in their first cycle and they say that they are very happy for the opportunity for progress and promise to keep the group together.  One of the members is Ely who sells clothes and wants to help her family this way to have the resources necessary to cover all their needs.  She’s asking for this loan to buy clothes so she can start out with a good amount of them.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su trabajo, vive con su familia quienes son su mayor inspiración para brindarles lo mejor. Actualmente posee una tortilleria ya que con esfuerzo sea superado ante las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado y gracias a ellos e su hogar nunca ha faltado el pan de cada día. Carmen desea ampliar más su negocio es decir comprar mas suministros que le permitan tener su negocio mas rentable es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar maíz, aceite, manteca entre otros para que los clientes queden satisfechos y siempre mantenga esa clientela que tiene. Ella espera que la ayuda sea recibida y que pronto su calidad de vida mejore con forme vayan pasando los días.
texts.en: Carmen is a very hardworking, honest woman who is responsible with her work.  She lives with her family who are the greatest inspiration for her to provide them the best.  She currently has a tortilla shop since she’s overcome the adversities life has presented thanks to her efforts and thanks to them too her home has never lacked daily bread.  Carmen wants to expand the business more, that is, to buy more supplies to have a more profitable business which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn, oil and lard, among others so that her customers will be satisfied and she will always retain the clientele she has.  She hopes to receive the help and that her quality of life will be improving as days go by.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil and lard, among others.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
From Vani district of West Georgia, Ketevan is 36 years old and lives with her husband, her 11-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law who is a pensioner. Ketevan works as a masseuse locally and earns a monthly income. Additionally, she runs an animal husbandry business consisting of a milk cow and two calves. The family produces cheese products which they sell at the local open market. Ketevan also grows nuts on agricultural land that she owns, selling 200-300 kg of them each year. The family also sows watermelons and melons on the family-owned land, selling on average 5000-7000 kg seasonally.

A very hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead, Ketevan has requested a loan to fence her agricultural land. She will also cultivate it and purchase nut saplings to plant and enlarge their garden. After several years, they will be able to harvest more products and sell for a good price. The increased income will be used to improve the family's living conditions and finance the education of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to fence her agricultural land, cultivate it, and purchase nut saplings.

loans.name: Phocas

texts.en:
Phocas is a 58-year-old farmer whose wife works as a farmer as well. He has spent 20 years in farming. He would like a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production. He plans to use the profits to buy a tractor instead of using human labor.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 47 year old married woman and mother of three young children, from Getafe, Bohol. 

She has run a sari-sari (variety) store business for almost four years now. Gaudiosa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as dry goods, sodas, snack foods, soaps, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as dry goods, sodas, snack foods, soaps, and toiletries

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells sanitary pads and diapers at Nkrotrodo near Elmina. She has done this for five years. Maame is married to a plumber. She and her husband use their incomes to pay for food, clothing, and their children's school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase more sanitary pads and diapers to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sanitary pads and diapers to sell
